title: Operations Manager with Business Intelligence Analyst Experience
description:
**Position Summary:**

We are seeking a strategic and proactive Business Operations Manager to oversee and optimize daily operations at our professional services firm, preferably with a software development and/or operations management background using BI software. The ideal candidate will possess a keen ability to identify operational inefficiencies affecting profitability, have strong business analytics skills, implement systems and processes to improve firm performance, and have experience using BI software to lead operational staff to excellence.

This role will also champion the adoption of AI technologies to enhance operational efficiency and drive a culture of innovation. Success in this role requires data analytics skills with BI software experience, identify process improvements, project management, change management expertise, strong communication and leadership skills and a passion for operational excellence. This position can lead to future roles creating and developing business enterprise platforms and applications.

**Key Responsibilities:**

**Operational Management:**

* Analyze current operational processes and performance, identifying areas for improvement and cost reduction using BI software and other software tools. (BI Software experience required, preferably DOMO or Microsoft Power BI).
* Analyzing data across multiple platforms.
* Design and implement standardized processes and best practices to increase efficiency, productivity, and profitability.
* Oversee day-to-day operations including workflow management, resource allocation, and scheduling.
* Develop, measure and monitor key performance indicators (KPIs) to measure operational effectiveness and all aspects of the business in an environment where data is stored in multiple platforms
* Implement and continue to enforce existing Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs).
* Design a digital dashboard showing real time KPIs (preferably DOMO or Microsoft Power BI experience).
* AI Integration and Innovation:
* Identify opportunities for AI and technology adoption to streamline operations and enhance service delivery.
* Collaborate with IT and leadership to pilot and implement AI-driven solutions (e.g., document automation, data analysis, client intake bots, predictive analytics).
* Train staff and promote a culture that embraces data quality, technology-driven change and continuous improvement.

**Employee Leadership and Management:**

* Manage, mentor, and develop a high-performing operational team.
* Ensure alignment of team goals with the firm's strategic objectives.
* Oversee hiring, onboarding, performance management, and professional development of staff.
* Foster a collaborative, accountable, and inclusive work environment.
* Taking ownership and championing a growth-minded, team-led firm where team members approach their work as an owner's mindset rather than an employee.

**Financial and Resource Management:**

* Assist with budget planning and operational cost control initiatives.
* Analyze and report on operational metrics that impact profitability and growth.
* Support billing, collections, and financial reporting processes in coordination with finance staff (if applicable).

**Compliance and Risk Management:**

* Ensure operational compliance with industry standards, legal regulations, and internal policies.
* Develop and enforce operational risk management practices.

**Qualifications:**

* Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Operations Management, Computer Science or a related field.
* Master's degree or MBA preferred.
* PMI/PMP Certification.
* Microsoft MVP and/or certifications preferred in Power BI or Copilot Studio.
* 5+ years of experience in business operations management, preferably within a professional services environment (law firm, software development, data engineering consulting, medical practice).
* Proven track record of leading operational improvements that drive profitability and efficiency.
* Strong familiarity with AI technologies and change management principles (Microsoft Copilot Studio and/or DOMO experience preferred).
* Excellent leadership, problem-solving, and organizational skills.
* Strong financial and data analysis skills; experience developing and using KPIs.
* Exceptional interpersonal and communication skills.
* Experience and proficiency with practice management software, CRM tools, Microsoft Office Suite and BI software.
* Change agent with the ability to drive cultural adoption of new technologies and methodologies.
* Experience with scaling business operations.

**Preferred Attributes:**

Experience leading technology initiatives or AI implementation projects.

* Six Sigma, Lean Management, Agile or similar operational efficiency certifications.
* Experience in firms of comparable size and complexity to ours (professional services, legal industry, 10+ employees.)
* Experience with Power BI or DOMO, Microsoft Copilot Studio.
* BI Software and analytics experience.

**Compensation and Benefits:**

* Competitive salary commensurate with experience
* Performance-based bonuses
* Health, dental, and vision insurance
* 401(k) plan with employer match
* Paid time off and holidays

**About Us:**

Join our team at York Law Firm and be a part of a professional services team that advocates for elder abuse and wrongful death victims and their families to ensure justice and accountability for our elders and their families. Our mission is to uncover elder neglect and fraud and to hold bad long term care operators and companies accountable for the exploitation of our seniors. Your commitment to support our team operationally to enable our team to provide high-quality legal case work-up will contribute to ensuring justice for elderly victims swiftly and efficiently within the legal system.

**Application Instructions:**

Please submit your resume and a cover letter detailing your experience in business operations management, BI software experience and any initiatives, including technology or AI implementation you have led. Please provide three job references.

Screened Applicants will be asked to complete a skills assessment test

title: Project Analyst (REMOTE)- Veterans Affairs, Must be VA Cleared
description:
**Job Summary:**

We are seeking a highly organized and detail-oriented **Project Analyst** to join our team in support of a high-impact federal initiative delivering a **Commercial Off-the-Shelf (COTS) Software as a Service (SaaS)** solution within a **FedRAMP-authorized** cloud-hosted environment. This role focuses on **Data Governance** support to ensure the integrity, security, and compliance of data across systems as the agency transitions from legacy platforms to a modern **Enterprise Learning Management System (ELMS).**

The Project Analyst will work closely with cross-functional teams including data stewards, cloud architects, security personnel, and program stakeholders to support the planning, coordination, and execution of data governance-related tasks within the project lifecycle.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* Support the development and implementation of a data governance framework aligned with federal compliance standards (e.g., **FedRAMP**, **FISMA**, **NIST 800-53**).
* Assist with identifying, cataloging, and mapping data sources across legacy and modern systems.
* Coordinate data quality, metadata management, and data lineage documentation activities.
* Monitor and track progress of data migration efforts to ensure alignment with project timelines and milestones.
* Document and support resolution of data-related risks, issues, and action items.
* Collaborate with technical teams to ensure secure data handling, transfer, and storage practices.
* Assist in developing Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs), governance policies, and user guidance for data management.
* Provide project status updates, dashboards, and reports related to data governance initiatives.
* Maintain strong communication with stakeholders to ensure alignment on data policies and governance goals.

**Qualifications:**

* Bachelor's degree in Information Systems, Data Management, Public Administration, Business, or a related field.
* 3+ years of experience in project coordination, business analysis, or data governance roles.
* Knowledge of federal data compliance requirements, especially **FedRAMP** standards and data protection best practices.
* Experience supporting SaaS implementations or cloud-based system migrations.
* Strong analytical, organizational, and communication skills.
* Familiarity with enterprise data governance tools and practices.
* Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced environment.
* **Experience working for the US Department of Veterans Affairs**

**Nice to Have:**

* Experience supporting federal IT or learning management system (LMS) modernization projects.
* Understanding of cloud services and platforms (e.g., **AWS**, **Azure**) and their security/compliance models.
* Experience with data cataloging tools or data governance platforms (e.g., Collibra, Informatica, Alation).
* Knowledge of project management methodologies (e.g., Agile, PMBOK).

**Compensation:** This is a full time role with an annual salary of $75,000-$80,000 annually, plus benefits

**Vetting:** Candidates selected will be subject to a background investigation for clearance eligibility by our government client.

*﻿ThunderYard Solutions is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. title: Business Systems Analyst
description:
Do you want to make a difference every day? Would you like to work for a global manufacturer with a world-class approach to people, process and product? Then make SPIROL your new home and career!

At SPIROL, we work with our customers to help them succeed. From automobiles, to hand an power tools, to aerospace and green energy, SPIROL provides the engineered metal fasteners that literally hold the world together.

We are looking for an experienced Business Systems Analyst (Order Fulfillment & Operations focus) to join our team in Danielson, CT. This role is 100% on site.

As a Business Systems Analyst, you will:

* Actively work with Subject Matter Experts to envision solutions using SPIROL owned software solutions or incorporating solutions not within SPIROL's current IT toolbox.
  + Evaluate existing ERP systems to identify areas for improvement and implement solutions to enhance production control and efficiency.
  + Gather, analyze and report on production data to support operational decision-making and strategic initiatives.
* Action project development using internal and external technical resources as needed to accomplish objectives. Support and collaborate with internal programmer analysts on a daily basis.
* Act as the liaison to department managers and end-users, facilitating end-user testing, and develop/document end-user work training materials.
* Work outside of software development, supporting other technology implementations such as shop floor production technology unified communications, and collaboration software. Remain current with industry trends and ERP technologies to recommend enhancements and innovations.

The successful candidate should have:

* Bachelor's Degree in Business Administration, Information Technology, Industrial Engineering or a related field, or equivalent work experience in software development, technical implementations or business management.
  + Manufacturing environment experience required (Automotive or Aerospace preferred)
* 5+ years' experience in ERP systems analysis in an industrial manufacturing or production environment. Experience documenting business requirements, technical writing, and delivering project documentation deliverables.
  + Experience leading at least one ERP migration.
* Strong planning and organization skills, and the ability to document work breakdowns, breaking large/complex requirements into logical phases/steps in delivering system functionality.
* Demonstrated project management experience, with a strong degree of independence in working with stakeholders to define and document requirements, conducting/leading meetings and developing consensus among diverse stakeholders representing disparate product lines across global site locations.

*WHY SPIROL:*

* Competitive Compensation Structure
* Health/Dental/Vision/Life Insurance
* Disability Insurance
* 401(k) with Company Matching
* ESOP Pension
* Pet Insurance
* Paid time off
* Employee Referral Bonus Program
* Education Assistance Program
* Employee Assistance Program

SPIROL an equal opportunity employer. SPIROL does not discriminate on the basis of race/color/religion/sex/national origin/veteran/disability/age/sexual orientation/gender identity or any other characteristic protected by law.

title: Business Analyst II (Product Owner) - EXP.O Customs, IS Operational Experience
description:
**Company Description**

“We’re not in the shipping business; we’re in the information business” -Peter Rose, Expeditors Founder

Global supply chain management is what we do, but at the heart of Expeditors you will find professionalism, leadership, and a friendly environment, all of which foster an innovative, customer service-based approach to logistics.

* 18,000 trained professionals
* 350+ locations worldwide across 60+ countries
* Fortune 500
* Globally unified systems

  
**Job Description**

The exp.o Customs application development team is responsible for developing a core business application designed to facilitate customs and government agency filings globally. The application is intended to provide the following functionality:

* Enable delivery of a consistent level of service and data to our customers
* Drive operational efficiency that is aligned with our business processes
* Deliver comprehensive compliance with governmental agencies and customer requirements

In the role of Product Owner and Business Analyst you will be a member of an agile software development team working on our global customs software using SAFe Lean-Agile development practices. The PO serves as the business proxy responsible for working with Product Management to prioritize and define the work of their team. The PO will collaborate with other leaders to set the vision for the team's work and be accountable to both technical and business stakeholders to deliver customer value. The PO must develop a strong grounding in the business domain that the team serves. The PO supports all team members in understanding how individual contributions align with the program vision. The PO must have a keen understanding of customer empathy and the customer value proposition to guide the ongoing development of their product to achieve customer satisfaction. The PO will clearly articulate the business outcomes and facilitate creation of features with clear acceptance criteria. The PO has a significant role in outcome-focused quality control and is the only team member empowered to accept work stories as complete.

**Roles and Responsibilities**

* Be a highly visible, fully embedded team member who participates in all team-level check-ins, meetings and other ceremonies.
* Build, refine, and prioritize team backlog in alignment with the program vision and roadmap.
* Draft specific team objectives for each Sprint and Program Increment (PI).
* Craft meaningful requirements that align stakeholder needs to capabilities.
* Create and execute tactical plans to achieve both short- and long-term objectives.
* Clearly define story acceptance criteria and accept stories into the team backlog.
* Collaborate with Product Managers and other Product Owners in Continuous Exploration to understand the business context, define features, and identify dependencies.
* Represent the team at Product Owner check-ins and pass relevant information back to the team.
* Participate in team demos, reviews and retrospectives with an eye toward continuous improvement.
* Prepare for Program activities, including PI Planning, System Demos, and Inspect and Adapt.
* Bridge between the development team and business stakeholders to address complexity or ambiguity.
* Analyze and decompose complex business requirements to build software systems and influence design for testability and scalability.

*This position is on-site and will reside in the greater Seattle, WA. area at one of the following locations depending on availability. Candidates must be local or willing to relocate. Relocation assistance is not offered for this position.*

* *Downtown Seattle*
* *Federal Way*
* *Lynnwood*
* *Bellevue (Factoria)*

  
**Qualifications**

MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS

* 1+ years of software business analysis experience or equivalent operational experience in logistics/brokerage.
* Ability to elicit and define functional and non-functional Acceptance Criteria.
* Proficiency with SAFe or other agile techniques and methodologies.
* Certification or ability to become certified as a SAFe Product Manager/Product Owner.
* Proven interpersonal skills and the ability to communicate effectively with a wide spectrum of people.
* Effective at navigating ambiguity and helping diverse teams drive towards clarity and consensus.
* Ability to compose concepts, ideas, and designs into actionable/measurable deliverables.
* Expertise in creating, analyzing, and improving processes.
* Management of multiple and competing priorities.
* Excellent time management and organization skills.
* Outstanding verbal and written communication.
* Ability to recognize and mitigate risks.
* Driven, strong 'get it done' attitude.

DESIRED QUALIFICATIONS

* System or Data analysis experience.
* Working knowledge of the UML (Unified Modeling Language) or similar concepts with the ability to effectively communicate business requirements through Business Object Models, Process Flows, State Diagrams, and other UML diagrams.
* Working knowledge of Office 2013 or above, Azure Dev Ops (VSTS/TFS), SharePoint.
* Passion for technology.
* Experience with Logistics/Brokerage Industry and/or Domain Engineering and Data Fabric projects.
* Experience as a Product Owner for an Agile team.
* Experience working with Reference Data and/or Data Governance.

*Applicants are required to be eligible to lawfully work in the U.S. immediately; employer will not transfer or sponsor applicants for U.S. work authorization (such as an H-1B visa) for this opportunity.*

 **Additional Information**

Expected base salary: $85,000 to $135,000

May be eligible for bonus following first year of continuous employment in position.

Expeditors offers competitive benefits to all full-time employees including:

* Paid vacation
* Holidays (10)
* Flexible Days (2)
* Paid Sick Time (accrual rate of 1 hour of sick time per 30 hours paid)
* 401(k) Retirement Savings Plan with employer match
* Employee Stock Purchase Plan (ESPP)
* Medical, Prescription Drug, Dental & Vision Coverage
* Health Savings Account (HSA)
* Life and Disability Insurance
* Paid Parental Leave (additional eligibility criteria)
* Dependent Care Flexible Spending Account (DC FSA)
* Commuter Benefit
* Employee Assistance Program (EAP)
* Training and Personnel Development Program
* Educational Assistance and Reimbursement
* Position is full time (40 hours per week) Monday through Friday

*All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.*

title: Junior Business Analyst – Transit & Infrastructure Projects
company: ARC Alternative and Renewable Construction LLC
description:
**Job Title**: Junior Business Analyst – Transit & Infrastructure Projects  
**Location**: Boston, New York, Baltimore, Washington DC, Remote (Hybrid)  
**Salary Range**: $104,000 – $145,600 (annual)

ARC Alternative and Renewable Construction LLC (ARC) provides governance, planning, and implementation solutions using advanced technologies in support of public infrastructure projects and sustainable development outcomes. We specialize in responsible AI deployment, stakeholder-centered design, and rigorous data analytics to help clients deliver on their mission with transparency, efficiency, and equity.

ARC is seeking candidates to fill positions across multiple teams to support high-impact public infrastructure initiatives. Our clients are relying on ARC’s expertise in:

* Advanced Analytics & Insight Generation
* Strategic Planning & Innovation Support
* Infrastructure Investment & Asset Strategy

Successful candidates will display experience, interest – or both – across all three knowledge domains.

**Position Overview**:  
ARC is seeking a Junior Business Analyst to support interdisciplinary teams working on infrastructure planning, capital program analysis, and digital transformation initiatives. This is a high-growth role ideal for detail-oriented professionals who want to apply analytical, organizational, and writing skills to real-world public infrastructure challenges.

**Key Responsibilities**:

* Assist in collecting and analyzing data related to budgets, project schedules, and infrastructure performance.
* Contribute to the development of business cases, cost models, and financial reports.
* Support preparation of proposals, presentations, and technical deliverables.
* Track project tasks, organize team communications, and ensure timely submission of client materials.
* Work alongside planners, engineers, and outreach teams to ensure quality and consistency.

**Required Qualifications**:

* Bachelor’s degree in business, planning, public policy, or a related field.
* 2+ years of professional or internship experience in project support, planning, or finance roles.
* Strong Excel, writing, and time management skills.
* Comfortable working in collaborative, cross-functional teams.

**Preferred Experience**:

* Familiarity and/or experience with state public transportation agencies, federal and state governing agencies and bodies and their regulations and requirements for infrastructure planning or delivery.
* Experience supporting transit, infrastructure, or government clients.
* Familiarity with budgeting software or financial reporting systems.
* Interest in public policy, infrastructure equity, or sustainable development.

**Why Join ARC**:

* You’ll be part of a team that applies technology and policy together to support climate, equity, and infrastructure resilience.
* You will grow professionally, work in highly collaborative settings and do meaningful work.
* Your analysis doesn’t sit on a shelf—it shapes how public investments are made.
* ARC provides very competitive compensation packages.
* Come build the future of Infrastructure with us!

If you have questions about this opportunity, feel free to contact our HR Human Resources Director for assistance. Email: HR@ARC-DEC.COM

Job Types: Full-time, Contract

Pay: $104,000.00 - $145,600.00 per year

Schedule:

* Day shift
* Evening shift

Work Location: In person

title: Business Systems Analyst Senior
description:
**Job Overview**  
*Note: This position is contingent upon contract award. Synergistic Agility is seeking qualified candidates to be part of a proposal submission for a federal contract with a federal agency. Employment offers will be extended only if the contract is awarded to our team.*

We are seeking a detail-oriented and mission-driven **Senior Business Systems Analyst** to join our federal IT services team. In this role, you will analyze current federal business processes, recommend IT solutions, and support enterprise system modernization using Agile methodologies. Your analytical insights and technical coordination will help shape system enhancements that improve operational outcomes and ensure mission alignment.

**Responsibilities**

* Analyze complex business processes across HR, financial, and health IT systems to identify gaps and opportunities.
* Collaborate with technical teams and government stakeholders to translate business needs into functional system requirements.
* Participate in Agile ceremonies, providing expertise in backlog refinement and user story definition.
* Assist in the design and integration of enterprise applications and ERP systems.
* Develop system documentation, including process flows, requirements traceability, and test plans.
* Support system configuration reviews, upgrades, and system assessments.
* Ensure solutions align with federal IT policies, including FISMA, FedRAMP, and Section 508 compliance.
* Communicate technical information clearly to business and non-technical stakeholders.
* Partner with DevOps teams to align user needs with release planning and automation.

**Experience**

* Proven experience as a Business Systems Analyst supporting federal programs, ERP systems, or enterprise application environments.
* Strong understanding of Agile project delivery and backlog management.
* Familiarity with IT infrastructure, system integration, and federal compliance standards.
* Ability to conduct gap analyses and define system-to-be states aligned with mission needs.
* Experience supporting business case development and documenting functional specs.

**Qualifications**

* **Bachelor’s degree** in Business, Information Systems, or related field.
* **5+ years** of business systems analysis experience.
* Experience with Jira, Confluence, and Agile tools is preferred.
* Federal experience (HHS, CMS) is highly desirable.

Join us in driving innovation through effective business analysis while contributing to the success of our organization!

title: Senior Data Operations Analyst
description:
**POSITION SUMMARY:**

A Senior Data Operations Analyst role is directly responsible for managing and scaling an organization's data systems to ensure efficient business operations that promote profitability and growth. Their role bridges business processes and technology, helping SMA make smarter, objective business decisions from the extensive data collected and stored. Work will be primarily achieved through project teams and individually, while having the capacity to work independently with discretion and good judgment.

**Essential Responsibilities:**

* Identify, develop and maintain sophisticated sets of data, linking various relational databases, and utilizing them to create advanced business analytics such as sales revenue and product forecasts.
* Create dashboards and Executive-ready reports using tools like SQL, Excel, Power BI, and SAP to present key findings .
* Demonstrates a strong understanding of procurement compliance, company policies, and strategic objectives to inform decision-making and co-author best practices.
* Participate in cross-functional process improvement projects that positively impact operations related to price, quality, delivery, and corporate social responsibility.
* Continuously collaborates with Finance, Operations, IT, Sales, and Marketing teams to enhance system usability and identify areas for improvement.
* Develops and maintains a clear and scalable logistics strategy to support the growth of the business.
* Participates in ongoing education to keep job knowledge aligned with market trends.
* Adheres to and upholds all Star Micronics LTD policies.
* Other duties as needed.

**SKILLS:**

* Ability to read and generally grasp general business periodicals, professional publications, technical procedures, and governmental regulations.
* Moderately developed oral and written communication skills with an ability to present information and respond to inquiries from groups of managers, employees, vendors, and occasionally government agents; ability to read reports, business correspondence, and procedure manuals.
* Exceptional reasoning skills with an ability to define problems, collect data, establish facts, and draw valid conclusions. Critical thinking will be a key to success in this role.

**QUALIFICATIONS:**

· Bachelor’s degree in Business Management, Applied Data Analytics, or related field required. Candidates who do not possess the required education may substitute additional related experience on a year-for-year basis.

· **10+ years** of hands-on experience in a Microsoft Windows environment, with expert-level proficiency in Microsoft Excel, SQL Server, and ERP system management (direct SAP experience preferred).

· **1+ year** of experience in AI development, with familiarity in Azure SQL, Python, Power Query, and Power BI considered a plus.

·

· 5+ years of enterprise-level analytics experience in a professional setting preferred.

· Must be authorized to work in the United States.

**PERSONAL CHARACTERISTICS:**

Organically inquisitive.

Empathetic communicator.

Strongly oriented towards analytical problem solving.

Precision orientated.

Thrives in collaborative environments.

Has an insatiable appetite for data.

Critical Thinker.

Self-starter with ability to prioritize, follow up, and see tasks through to completion.

**TRAVEL REQUIREMENTS:**

· 10% -15% travel as necessary in support of subcontracting efforts and related activities (Mostly domestic, but potential for international locations possible)

· Valid U.S. Passport or U.S. Passport card a plus.

title: Integrated Business Planning (IBP) Analyst
description:
**Job Title:** Integrated Business Planning (IBP) Analyst

**Location:** Irvine, CA  
**Contract Duration:** 12 Months (W2 Contract)  
**Work Schedule:** Monday to Friday, 8:00 AM – 5:00 PM  
**Reports To:** Manager – Integrated Business Planning (IBP)

**Position Summary:**

We are seeking a highly analytical and detail-oriented **Integrated Business Planning (IBP) Analyst** to support performance tracking, root cause analysis, and strategic reporting for our supply chain and planning functions. This role will turn data into actionable insights to improve KPIs and support the weekly and monthly Integrated Business Planning processes.

You will collaborate with cross-functional teams including supply and demand planning, finance, production scheduling, commercial operations, and global process excellence teams to support business decisions and drive continuous improvement.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* Develop and maintain standard KPI reports with diagnostics, root cause analysis, and proposed corrective actions.
* Assist functional planners in preparing weekly demand and supply execution content (e.g., back order status, inventory risks, service level impact).
* Support monthly IBP milestone reporting with complete and decision-ready content.
* Maintain and enhance local planning tools (e.g., capacity planning, safety stock modeling, MRP processes, demand forecasting tools).
* Generate operational reports and dashboards to provide insights for planning teams.
* Prepare executive-level presentations and communication materials for weekly and monthly updates.
* Track product portfolio changes (Phase-In/Phase-Out status) to maintain visibility and alignment.
* Contribute to strategic portfolio segmentation and planning method definitions (forecasting, inventory, replenishment).
* Create and manage project tracking tools to support continuous improvement initiatives.
* Learn and leverage ERP and planning systems for effective data extraction and reporting.

**Key Performance Indicators (KPIs):**

* Supply Plan Attainment
* Forecast Error & Forecast Bias
* Safety Stock Health
* Back Order Performance
* Capacity Utilization
* Kit Utilization

**Qualifications:**

**Education:**

* Bachelor’s degree in Business, Engineering, Supply Chain Management, Economics, or Statistics.

**Experience:**

* Minimum 2 years of experience in a reporting or analytics role (entry-level graduates with strong technical skills may also be considered).
* Experience with planning or ERP systems, preferably SAP.
* Familiarity with business intelligence tools such as QlikView, Tableau, or Power BI.
* Proficient in Microsoft Office, especially Excel and PowerPoint.

**Additional Skills:**

* Strong analytical, problem-solving, and data interpretation skills.
* Ability to collaborate across departments and communicate insights to stakeholders.
* Detail-oriented and proactive in identifying opportunities for process improvement.

**Preferred Qualifications:**

* Prior experience in an analytics function within supply chain, manufacturing, or consulting environments.
* Exposure to Integrated Business Planning or S&OP processes.

Pay: $52.00 - $62.00 per hour

Expected hours: 40 per week

title: RPA Consultant
description:
**Automation Consultant**   
**Remote anywhere within the US**

**Job description:**

In the role of an Automation Consultant, you will be part of the consulting team in different phases of the project including discovery, solution generation, design, development and deployment (for small/low complexity projects); document system understanding, contribute to knowledge transfer with the objective of providing high-quality and value-adding consulting solutions to customers within guidelines, policies and norms of Infosys.  
**Responsibilities:**

* Understand gaps in existing client systems/As-Is Processes and help the technology team to create the right technology-based solution fitment. Liaise with relevant people in the respective verticals/horizontals to understand and learn different processes and therefore recognize the right solution fit
* Front End Requirements Management for Software Implementation projects
* Validate Requirements Collection Process and Review Requirement Specification Documents
* Conducting Functional reviews and functional testing of the s/w applications
* Co-ordination with the clients and the project teams to ensure successful delivery
* Managing stakeholder expectations.
* Domain expertise in service offering such as Finance and Accounting or Sourcing and Procurement or Order Management.

**Skills Required**

* Knowledge of at least 1 process/technology domain and have practical experience of having handled at least 1 module/technology/tool
* Knowledge of software tools & technology to some extent
* Good knowledge of MS Office preferred advanced Excel and PowerPoint skills.
* Good client facing and communication skills, ability to conduct demos, trainings etc.
* Good knowledge of BPO Processes with strong capabilities in at least one Functional Service area be it HRO, F&A, S&P et al
* Should have good people management skills
* Good team player

**Qualifications :**

**Basic:**

* Bachelor’s degree or foreign equivalent required from an accredited institution. Will also consider three years of progressive experience in the specialty in lieu of every year of education.
* 4 years of relevant work experience

**Preferred:**

* Min 1 year experience in RPA/AI-ML implementations
* Experience in UiPath/Blue Prism/Automation Anywhere preferable

**Who We Are**

Infosys BPM Limited, a wholly owned subsidiary of Infosys Limited (NYSE: INFY), provides end-to-end transformative business process management (BPM) services for its clients across the globe. The company’s integrated IT and BPM solutions approach enables it to unlock business value across industries and service lines, and address business challenges for its clients. Utilizing innovative business excellence frameworks, ongoing productivity improvements, process reengineering, automation, and cutting-edge technology platforms, Infosys BPM enables its clients to achieve their cost reduction objectives, improve process efficiencies, enhance effectiveness, and deliver superior customer experience.

Infosys BPM has 47 delivery centers in 16 countries spread across 5 continents, with 58,702 employees from 110 nationalities, as of December 2024.

The company has been consistently ranked among the leading BPM companies globally and has received over 60 awards and recognitions in the last 5 years, from key industry bodies and associations like the Outsourcing Center, SSON, and GSA, among others. Infosys BPM also has very robust people practices, as substantiated by the various HR-specific awards it has won over the years. The company has consistently been ranked among the top employers of choice, on the basis of its industry leading HR best practices. The company’s senior leaders contribute widely to industry forums as BPM strategists.

**EOE/Minority/Female/Veteran/Disabled/Sexual Orientation/Gender Identity/Nationality**

title: District Manager, Neuroscience - Detroit, MI
description:
**Company Description**

AbbVie's mission is to discover and deliver innovative medicines and solutions that solve serious health issues today and address the medical challenges of tomorrow. We strive to have a remarkable impact on people's lives across several key therapeutic areas – immunology, oncology, neuroscience, and eye care – and products and services in our Allergan Aesthetics portfolio. For more information about AbbVie, please visit us at www.abbvie.com. Follow @abbvie on X, Facebook, Instagram, YouTube, LinkedIn and Tik Tok.

 **Job Description**

Purpose

Coordinate commercial activity within in-field teams to ensure targets are reached for increasing sales within an assigned geography. Create, implement, and communicate District Sales Plan and monitor progress.

Responsibilities

Coordinate in-field activity to achieve results and agreed-upon targets. Maximize market, segment, and team dynamics to drive both top- and bottom-line results.

* Ensure smooth, collaborative efforts in both day to day and long term business execution. Set tone and pace for business process and organization.
* Understand and present a market and franchise/business point of view when leading teams and championing in-field meeting by developing a mastery of product and disease state information, as well as pertinent Market dynamics, including Managed Care landscape.
* Coach, mentor, educate and develop direct and indirect team members to enhance individual skills and elevate overall team performance. Hold direct reports accountable to behaviors and expectations.
* Provide direction and insights to key internal partners in business planning process. Consistently exemplify the AbbVie Ways of Working.

  
**Qualifications**

Qualifications

* Bachelor's degree in health, sciences, pharmacy or business-related field preferred or relevant and equivalent industry experience required.
* Business analysis and planning skills that drive sales performance.
* Proven District Manager leadership to include: In good standing with safety and compliance standards. Minimum four years pharmaceutical sales management experience (external management experience can be considered). Is currently meeting performance expectations. Is living the AbbVie Way and effectively demonstrating the Leadership Attributes.
* Excellent judgment and decision making skills. Ability to articulate the scientific aspects of treatments and therapeutic areas
* Proven ability to deliver candid, effective feedback and efficiently manage performance. Ability to develop talent for promotional opportunities.
* Ability to create a culture of winning and full team engagement.
* An essential requirement of your position is to satisfy all applicable health care industry representative (HCIR) credentialing requirements to gain and maintain entry into facilities and organizations that are in your assigned territory. You must also be in good standing and/or eligible to obtain these credentials.
* These HCIR credentialing requirements may include, but are not limited to, background checks, drug screens, proof of immunization/vaccination for various diseases, fingerprinting and specific licenses required by individual state or cities. Please remember that you are solely responsible for ensuring that you satisfy all HCIR credentialing requirements and for any associated liability for failing to do so. to AbbVie has resources to answer questions you may have regarding your responsibilities.

  
**Additional Information**

Applicable only to applicants applying to a position in any location with pay disclosure requirements under state or local law:

Individual compensation paid within this range will depend on many factors including geographic location, and we may ultimately pay more or less than the posted range. This range may be modified in the future.
* We offer a comprehensive package of benefits including paid time off (vacation, holidays, sick), medical/dental/vision insurance and 401(k) to eligible employees.
* This job is eligible to participate in our short-term incentive programs.
* This job is eligible to participate in our long-term incentive programs

Note: No amount of pay is considered to be wages or compensation until such amount is earned, vested, and determinable. The amount and availability of any bonus, commission, incentive, benefits, or any other form of compensation and benefits that are allocable to a particular employee remains in the Company's sole and absolute discretion unless and until paid and may be modified at the Company’s sole and absolute discretion, consistent with applicable law.

title: Sales & Reporting Analyst
description:
**About KREWE**

KREWE is an independent, high-fashion eyewear brand rooted in the vibrant culture and boundless creativity of our hometown, New Orleans. Since our launch in 2013, KREWE has grown into a dynamic and evolving brand known for its distinctive, handcrafted sun and optical frames. Designed in New Orleans and meticulously crafted with exceptional attention to detail, our eyewear reflects a commitment to quality and individuality.

Our presence spans brick-and-mortar boutiques, innovative mobile and tiny house concept stores, and a thriving e-commerce platform. You can also find KREWE at premier independent shops and major retailers across the country. Celebrated for our unique approach to design, KREWE has cultivated a loyal following among style-conscious consumers and influential tastemakers.

As we continue to expand, we’re looking for passionate, driven, and innovative individuals to join our talented team. At KREWE our work is fun, intense, and fast-paced. We believe our people are our greatest asset and those that work at KREWE are high performing, passionate, and ambitious. People here work hard because they believe in [our mission] and the brand. At KREWE, you will be given the opportunity to own your role and truly make a difference, no matter your level. If this sounds like the right environment for you we invite you to apply below.

We are seeking a detail oriented and analytical **Sales and Reporting Analyst** to support our retail, e-commerce, and wholesale teams through data-driven insights and reporting. This role plays a key part in tracking sales performance, customer behavior, and inventory trends to help optimize merchandising, pricing, and promotional strategies in a fast-moving fashion environment.

This role is based in our New Orleans Headquarters 5 days a week.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* Analyze sales performance metrics, trends, and key performance indicators (KPIs).
* Prepare and distribute regular reports and dashboards to track sales performance.
* Monitor sales targets and provide insights on opportunities for growth.
* Conduct variance analysis to identify sales trends and deviations from forecasts.
* Collect, clean, and organize sales data from multiple sources (CRM, ERP, POS, etc.).
* Develop and maintain dashboards using tools like Excel, Power BI, or Tableau.
* Partner with IT and Sales Leaders to ensure data accuracy and integrity across all reporting platforms.
* Help develop and improve financial models and dashboards for better decision-making.
* Assist in sales forecasting and demand planning to support business strategy.
* Work closely with the sales and marketing teams to optimize pricing and promotions.

* Analytical mindset with strong problem-solving skills.

* teams

title: Senior Business Intelligence Analyst
description:
**Company Description**

**About CyberArk**:  
CyberArk (NASDAQ: CYBR), is the global leader in Identity Security. Centered on privileged access management, CyberArk provides the most comprehensive security offering for any identity – human or machine – across business applications, distributed workforces, hybrid cloud workloads and throughout the DevOps lifecycle. The world’s leading organizations trust CyberArk to help secure their most critical assets. To learn more about CyberArk, visit our CyberArk blogs or follow us on X, LinkedIn or Facebook.

 **Job Description**

CyberArk is seeking a Senior Business Intelligence (BI) Analyst with a passion for sales strategy and business insight to join our Business Analytics team. In this role, you will act as a strategic partner to Sales and Sales Operations leaders around the globe—translating data into compelling narratives that drive better, faster decisions. You’ll play a key role in shaping how performance is measured, understood, and improved across our global go-to-market (GTM) organization. While you’ll contribute to dashboard development and scalable reporting in Tableau, this role goes far beyond building reports—you’ll be expected to uncover trends, connect dots across complex datasets, and communicate insights in a way that resonates with non-technical audiences. The ideal candidate is a business-minded analyst with strong sales acumen, excellent communication skills, and an instinct for asking the right questions to get to the heart of the problem.

**Responsibilities:**

* Serve as an embedded analytics partner to global Sales and Sales Operations stakeholders, proactively identifying opportunities to improve pipeline, productivity, and conversion
* Craft clear, executive-ready narratives based on deep-dive analyses of sales performance, pipeline coverage, segmentation, and revenue trends
* Translate complex data and technical concepts into actionable recommendations that are easy for non-technical stakeholders to understand and act upon
* Design and evolve self-service dashboards and tools in Tableau that reduce friction and enable faster time-to-decision
* Maintain a high bar for data accuracy and consistency across reports and ad hoc deliverables
* Collaborate cross-functionally with Sales, RevOps, Marketing, Finance, and IT to align on business definitions and ensure reliable analytics infrastructure
* Help drive a data-driven culture by enabling stakeholders to interpret KPIs and use insights effectively

#LI-JA1

#LI-Hybrid

 **Qualifications**  

* 4–6 years of experience in Sales Analytics, Sales Operations, Business Intelligence, or a related field
* Proven ability to extract and communicate insights from complex data—especially in a Sales or GTM environment
* Strong business judgment, with experience working directly with senior stakeholders and cross-functional teams
* Working knowledge of SQL and experience with Tableau or a similar BI platform (depth of tool expertise less important than the ability to learn quickly)
* Understanding of B2B sales metrics, pipeline stages, and CRM data (Salesforce experience a plus)
* Excellent storytelling skills—both written and verbal—with the ability to tailor messages to executive and frontline audiences
* Self-starter who thrives in a fast-paced, dynamic environment and isn’t afraid to ask questions or challenge assumptions
* Bachelor’s degree in a quantitative or business-related field
* Smart, bold but humble attitude to work collaboratively with CyberArk colleagues

  
**Additional Information**

CyberArk is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or protected Veteran status.

We are unable to sponsor or take over sponsorship of employment Visa at this time.

The salary range for this position is $87,000 – $121,000/year, plus commissions or discretionary bonus, which will be based on the employee’s performance. Base pay may also vary considerably depending on job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. The compensation package includes a wide range of medical, dental, vision, financial, and other benefits.

title: Business Analyst (ITIL Configuration)
description:
**Job Overview:**

* The configuration manager oversees the configuration management process, as a key function within the IT Service Management team, ensuring all configuration items (CI) are accurately documented and maintained.
* This individual is responsible for establishing and maintaining the configuration management plan and coordinating with various IT teams to enforce CM practices.
* Their work involves defining configuration identifications, managing configuration changes, and conducting reviews & audits to ensure compliance with HHS agency policies and standards.
* The configuration manager must ensure that CM tools and resources are used effectively.
* They act as a bridge between operations, infrastructure, applications, and ITSM teams to guarantee that everyone is aligned with the CM strategy.

**Duties & Responsibilities:**

* Reviews, analyzes, and evaluates business systems and user needs. Formulates systems to parallel overall business strategies.
* Experienced with business process reengineering and identifying new applications of technology to business problems to make business more effective.
* Familiar with industry standard business process mapping, and reengineering. Prepares solution options, risk identification, and financial analyses such as cost/benefit, ROI, buy/build, etc.
* Writes detailed description of user needs, program functions, and steps required to develop or modify computer programs.

**EXPERIENCE-**

**Required Qualifications & Skills:**

* ***5 Years:*** Advanced knowledge of ITIL configuration management principles and best practices; prior experience in developing and maintaining configuration management process & polices.
* ***5 Years:*** Excellent problem-solving and critical thinking skills and a strong attention to detail.
* ***5 Years:*** Experience supporting and maintaining CMDB platforms such as BMC Helix, ServiceNow, Atlassian, etc.
* ***4 Years:*** Performs regular configuration audits to verify their completeness, accuracy, and compliance with the CM plan and system objectives.
* ***4 Years:*** Responsible for verifying and auditing the configuration status and assists with configuration verification, to ensure that the CIs are consistent with their specifications and requirements.
* ***4 Years:*** 3-5 years of demonstrated work experience as a Configuration Manager or a similar role overseeing IT Service Management processes & standards.
* ***4 Years:*** ITIL 4 Foundation certification.

**Contract Details:**

* The primary work location(s) will be at **4601 W. Guadalupe St. Austin, TX 78751**.
* The working position is Hybrid. ***Position will be 3 days remote with 2 days (Tuesdays and Thursdays) required to be onsite at the location listed above. Program will only accept LOCAL ONLY candidates for this position.***
* Services shall be provided during normal business hours unless otherwise coordinated through the **Texas Health and Human Services Commission**. Normal business hours are Monday through Friday from **8:00 AM to 5:00 PM**, excluding State holidays when the agency is closed.
* Services are expected to start **07/21/2025** and are expected to complete by **08/31/2025**. Total estimated hours per Candidate shall not exceed **280** hours. This service may be amended, renewed, and/or extended providing both parties agree to do so in writing.
* ***S# 529501430***

* Monday to Friday

title: Chief Financial Officer for Milwaukee College Prep
description:
**ORGANIZATION OVERVIEW**

Founded in 1997, Milwaukee College Prep (MCP) is a leading network of four K4-8th grade public charter schools that every child in Milwaukee is eligible to attend free of charge. This year they added K3 to one of our campuses — they know that high quality early childhood education can be transformational when done right. They now provide K3 programming to 100 young scholars at our MCP: Lola Rowe North Campus. No matter the age or the campus, MCP schools live our mission; “knowledge plus character pave the road to college and beyond.” Milwaukee College Prep is absolutely determined to provide equal parts academic rigor and character development so that our scholars have the foundation necessary to determine their own destinies. They absolutely believe, and research supports, that an uncompromising K-8 education taught by an exceptional team of teachers is the difference between dreams realized and dreams denied. If a child can’t read, problem-solve, draw inferences, think critically, be self-disciplined and self-determined, that child will not realize his or her dreams…he or she won’t even come close. Having determined, loving, master teachers in every classroom makes the difference. MCP ensures that the classroom is at the center of all its work.

**MISSION ALIGNMENT**

The Chief Financial Officer (CFO) provides strategic and operational leadership of all financial functions at Milwaukee College Prep (MCP), ensuring the school network’s long-term fiscal sustainability, regulatory compliance, and operational excellence. As a key member of the Executive Leadership Team, the CFO advises the CEO, President, and Board of Directors and plays a critical role in driving mission-aligned financial strategy to support academic and organizational goals.

· Champion MCP’s mission and core values — Trust, Respect, Empathy, Courage, and Kindness — in all financial leadership, decisions, and partnerships.

· Strategic Financial Leadership

· Lead the development and execution of long-term financial strategies that support organizational growth, innovation, and impact.

· Serve as a key advisor to the CEO, President, and Board on all financial matters, ensuring data-informed decision-making and fiscal discipline.

· Incorporate scenario planning and forecasting to navigate enrollment shifts, economic conditions, and potential funding changes. Communicates and maintains positive working relationships with external parties providing financial services, including banks, lenders, investment advisors, insurance companies, investment bankers, and associated governmental agencies.

To learn more, please visit https://www.milwaukeecollegeprep.com/

**POSITION OVERVIEW**

The Chief Financial Officer (CFO) provides strategic and operational leadership of all financial functions at Milwaukee College Prep (MCP), ensuring the school network’s long-term fiscal sustainability, regulatory compliance, and operational excellence. As a key member of the Executive Leadership Team, the CFO advises the CEO, President, and Board of Directors and plays a critical role in driving mission-aligned financial strategy to support academic and organizational goals.

**RESPONSIBILITIES**

**Financial Operations & Oversight**

· Direct all accounting, financial reporting, forecasting, and audit functions.

· Ensure timely, accurate, and transparent reporting to internal and external stakeholders.

· Develop and monitor financial KPIs and ROIs to evaluate performance and guide course corrections.

**Regulatory Compliance & Risk Management**

· Ensure full compliance with all federal, state, and local financial regulations, including those related to charter schools and public funding.

· Oversee grant management, government contracting, and audit readiness.

· Proactively assess and manage financial risk to protect both organizational and financial integrity.

**Budgeting, Equity, & Resource Allocation**

· Execute the annual budgeting process, aligning resources with MCP’s strategic priorities.

· Ensure budgeting, resource allocation and diversification efforts reflect MCP’s commitment to equity, excellence, and access for all students.

· Provide clear, actionable financial insights to department leaders and school principals to inform site-level decision-making.

**Team Development & Leadership**

· Build, lead, and mentor a high-performing finance team aligned with MCP’s values and commitment to excellence.

· Set clear performance expectations and support ongoing development and professional growth.

**Collaboration & Change Leadership**

· Collaborate with fellow executives to ensure financial strategy supports academic and operational goals.

· Lead cross-functional change initiatives that improve efficiency, cost-effectiveness, and mission impact.

**Board & Stakeholder Engagement**

· Serve as the primary liaison to the Board Finance Committee, providing clear, strategic financial reporting and recommendations.

· Build strong relationships with funders, financial institutions, and oversight agencies (e.g., DPI, charter authorizer).

**Process Improvement & Systems Optimization**

· Evaluate and improve financial systems, processes, and technologies to increase efficiency and accuracy.

· Identify and implement best practices that enhance internal controls and resource stewardship.

**Vendor & Resource Management**

Lead financial aspects of procurement strategy and vendor relationships, ensuring quality, cost-effectiveness, and alignment with MCP needs.

**Technology & Data Systems**

· Oversee the implementation and use of financial systems (e.g., ERP, dashboards, data tools) to support informed decision-making and reporting.

· Leverage technology to effectively drive transparency, accountability, and automation in financial operations.

**QUALIFICATIONS**

· Bachelor’s degree in finance, accounting, or a related field; MBA preferred.

· Prior experience managing equitable funding strategies across diverse communities.

· Bachelor’s degree required. Advanced degree preferred.

· Minimum of 8 years of progressive financial leadership, or equivalent, experience.

· Successful financial leadership in organizations operating under government-funded programs (e.g., charter schools, Title I).

· Proficiency in financial software systems, including spreadsheet modeling and ERP platforms (e.g., Sage Intacct, NetSuite).

\\*Please note that comptrollers, finance directors, and others, are encouraged to apply.

**KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, and ATTRIBUTES**

· Deep alignment with MCP’s mission and a personal commitment to educational equity.

· Experience working with WI Department of Public Instruction, MPS, and School Nutrition Programs is desirable.

· Track record of managing cash flow and forecasting in complex financial environments.

· Strong strategic planning, analytical thinking, and interpersonal communication skills.

· Demonstrated success in preparing and presenting financial reports and communicating organizational financial position with clarity and confidence.

· Highly organized with the ability to manage multiple priorities and deliver assignments on time.

· Ability to influence and collaborate across all levels of the organization and with external stakeholders.

· Excellent communication skills, both written and oral, with an ability to build and maintain relationships across a diverse community.

· Positive attitude and commitment to being a collaborative and reliable teammate.

**COMMITMENTS FROM MILWAUKEE COLLEGE PREP**

Milwaukee College Prep is an equal opportunity employer. Personnel administration in the school shall be conducted so as not to discriminate of the basis of age, race, creed, color, pregnancy, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression national origin disability, political affiliation, handicap, marital status, ancestry, citizenship, arrest or conviction record, membership in the national guard, stat defense force or any other reserve component of the military forces of the United State of Wisconsin, use or nonuse of lawful products off school premises during non-working hours, or other reason prohibited by state or federal law. This policy shall apply to hiring, placement, assignment, seniority, transfer promotion, lay-off, recall or termination. Similarly, all salaries, wages, benefit programs and personnel policies shall be administered in conformity with this policy. Reasonable accommodations shall be made for qualified individuals with a disability or handicap, unless such accommodations would impose an undue hardship to the school. If you believe you have been discriminated against in violation of this policy, you may file a complaint. Responsibility for overseeing the school’s equal employment opportunity and affirmative action programs and investigating discrimination complaints is assigned to the Chief People Officer (Formerly HR Director). Milwaukee College Prep offers a generous 403(b) retirement plan, a generous health care plan including dental and vision, tuition reimbursement, professional development reimbursement, student loan reimbursement, and school paid Life and AD&D insurance.

References will not be contacted until a candidate has been notified. Background checks will subsequently be performed. All inquiries and interactions with potential candidates are kept in strict confidence. The position will remain open until filled.

**INSTRUCTIONS FOR APPLICANTS**

For full consideration, please apply here: https://www.paycomonline.net/v4/ats/web.php/jobs/ViewJobDetails?job=22678&clientkey=ED7FE791F1E19827B6098A2D9B4961E1https://www.paycomonline.net/v4/ats/web.php/jobs/ViewJobDetails?job=22678&clientkey=ED7FE791F1E19827B6098A2D9B4961E1 no later than 5:00 p.m. CT on July 11, 2025.

*Leading Transitions is committed to the vitality and growth of mission-based, nonprofit, philanthropic, and community-centered efforts and organizations, and their leaders. The firm’s inclusive practices provide the flexibility and creativity necessary to adapt to the intricacies and dynamics of any community.* *We believe that periods of change are transformational and bring new diverse opportunities*.

**Job Summary**  
We are seeking a highly skilled and strategic Chief Financial Officer (CFO) to join our executive team. The CFO will be responsible for overseeing all financial aspects of the company, providing leadership in financial planning, analysis, and reporting. This role requires a deep understanding of both GAAP and IFRS standards, as well as expertise in governmental accounting and technical accounting. The ideal candidate will possess strong business analysis skills and be adept at financial modeling and forecasting to drive the company's financial strategy.

**Responsibilities**

* Develop and implement financial strategies that align with the company's goals and objectives.
* Oversee the preparation of accurate financial reports in compliance with GAAP and IFRS standards.
* Manage payroll processes to ensure timely and accurate compensation for all employees.
* Conduct comprehensive business analysis to identify opportunities for growth and cost savings.
* Lead financial planning efforts, including budgeting, forecasting, and long-term financial modeling.
* Ensure compliance with governmental accounting regulations and reporting requirements.
* Provide insights on financial performance to the executive team and board of directors.
* Collaborate with other departments to support overall business objectives through effective financial management.
* Monitor cash flow, investment strategies, and risk management practices to safeguard company assets.

**Experience**

* Proven experience as a CFO or in a similar senior financial leadership role within a dynamic organization.
* Extensive knowledge of GAAP, IFRS, governmental accounting, technical accounting, and payroll management practices.
* Strong background in financial planning, forecasting, business analysis, and financial modeling techniques.
* Excellent analytical skills with the ability to interpret complex data sets and provide actionable insights.
* Exceptional leadership abilities with a track record of building high-performing finance teams.
* Strong communication skills to effectively present financial information to stakeholders at all levels.

Join our team as we strive for excellence in our financial operations while fostering an environment of growth and innovation!

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $46,050.70 - $55,458.91 per year

Benefits:

* Health insurance
* Paid time off

title: Data/Business Analyst
description:

We service garden centers in large mass market retailers across the country. We are looking for an addition to our production planning team.

title: District Manager, Neuroscience - Miami, FL
description:
**Company Description**

AbbVie's mission is to discover and deliver innovative medicines and solutions that solve serious health issues today and address the medical challenges of tomorrow. We strive to have a remarkable impact on people's lives across several key therapeutic areas – immunology, oncology, neuroscience, and eye care – and products and services in our Allergan Aesthetics portfolio. For more information about AbbVie, please visit us at www.abbvie.com. Follow @abbvie on X, Facebook, Instagram, YouTube, LinkedIn and Tik Tok.

 **Job Description**

Purpose

Coordinate commercial activity within in-field teams to ensure targets are reached for increasing sales within an assigned geography. Create, implement, and communicate District Sales Plan and monitor progress.

Responsibilities

Coordinate in-field activity to achieve results and agreed-upon targets. Maximize market, segment, and team dynamics to drive both top- and bottom-line results. Ensure smooth, collaborative efforts in both day to day and long term business execution. Set tone and pace for business process and organization.

* Understand and present a market and franchise/business point of view when leading teams and championing in-field meeting by developing a mastery of product and disease state information, as well as pertinent Market dynamics, including Managed Care landscape.
* Coach, mentor, educate and develop direct and indirect team members to enhance individual skills and elevate overall team performance. Hold direct reports accountable to behaviors and expectations.

**Qualifications**

Qualifications

title: Sr. Business Analyst (AI)
description:
The Senior Business Analyst will join a team to lead the requirements gathering and business analysis work for an application development team building AI solutions for a federal government agency. They will be the primary point of contact to the customer, facilitating ideation, requirements, and working sessions to plan, design, and develop AI solutions to drive efficiencies into existing government systems and processes. The Senior BA will bring strong analytical, communication, and technical skills to bridge the gap between business stakeholders and the technical team. They will independently gather and document business requirements / user stories, create workflows and Visio diagrams, and facilitate the successful delivery of AI-driven solutions. Responsibilties include:

* Facilitate requirements workshops, stakeholder meetings, and regular status updates to ensure clarity and progress
* Create and update user stories throughout the Agile development process
* Identify opportunities for leveraging AI to improve business processes and operations.
* Develop and maintain process workflows, diagrams, and visual representations of requirements using tools such as Microsoft Visio.
* Collaborate with the technical team to design and implement AI-driven solutions, ensuring alignment with business objectives

Projected compensation range for this position is $120K - $140K. The final salary offered will generally fall within this range and is determined by various factors, including but not limited to the individual's particular combination of education, knowledge, skills, competencies, and experience, as well as internal pay equity, location, contract-specific affordability and other organizational requirements.

Required Skills

* 8+ years of business analysis for IT systems
* Strong working knowledge of AI tools and technology
* Proven experience in a senior BA role, independently working with business users and driving IT development work
* Experience working within Agile development teams
* Experience gathering, analyzing, and documenting business requirements / user stories from stakeholders across various departments
* Must be a US Citizen

Desirable Skills

* Experience working for federal government customers
* Active Fedeal Government Public Trust clearance
* AI related certifications
* Certified Scrum Master;

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $120,000.00 - $140,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* 401(k) matching
* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Health savings account
* Paid time off
* Tuition reimbursement
* Vision insurance

Compensation Package:

* Yearly pay

title: Accela Senior Business Analyst
description:
Link Technologies (LinkTechConsulting.com), a Las Vegas-based IT consulting firm, is currently seeking an Accela Senior Business Analyst to join our team.

***JOB SUMMARY***  
This position serves as a liaison between business users, functional subject matter experts, systems analysts, and technical developers. Responsibilities include analyzing business processes by assessing current and future state process flows, documenting process diagrams, eliciting and documenting requirements, performing system fit/gap analysis, contributing to design specifications, developing and overseeing technology-related request for proposals, and participating in systems testing. As a key member of technology services, this role contributes to delivering high customer value through innovative solutions and plays a crucial part in exceeding customer expectations.

***QUALIFICATIONS***

* Bachelor's Degree in computer science, information systems, business administration, mathematics or a related field. o Additional appropriate type and level of experience may be substituted for the minimum education requirement on a one (1) year for one (1) year basis.

***Minimum of five (5) years of recent, professional-level experience in business analysis, including at least two (2) years in a lead role on projects of varying sizes. This experience should include:***

* Leading process analysis and improvement initiatives that span multiple teams or departments.
* Identifying and delivering enterprise-wide system enhancement recommendations.
* Conducting technical evaluations in complex, highly integrated software system environments.
* Developing process and system diagrams to document current and future state operations.
* Producing end-user training documentation or converting technical content into training materials.
* Creating process handoff and system integration diagrams across interconnected systems.
* Collaborating effectively with peers, customers, and vendors to achieve shared outcomes.
* Assisting both technical and non-technical stakeholders in understanding the impact of process handoffs on requirements and system integrations.
* Clearly documenting workflows for use by internal teams and organizational leadership.
* Defining requirements to integrate new tools into existing technical infrastructure.

***ADDITIONAL SKILLS REQUIRED***

* Must be able to obtain CJIS Certification within 90 days from start date.
* Strong written and verbal communication skills.
* Highly self-motivated with strong organizational abilities.
* Focused on delivering exceptional customer experiences.
* Proficient in facilitating customer interactions and engagements.
* Skilled in problem analysis and root cause identification.
* Effective in preparing and delivering presentations on a variety of topics.
* Experienced in building consensus and managing conflict.
* Capable of conducting successful negotiations.

***PREFERRED EXPERIENCE***

* Experience across a broad spectrum of technology solutions
* ITIL/ITSM
* Agile/Scrum
* Business Process Management (BPM)
* Lean Six Sigma / Lean process development
* Change Management
* Business case development and delivery
* Accela or similar workflow platforms
* Experience with AI tools is a plus
* Microsoft Office including Visio, Azure DevOps

***RESPONSIBILITIES***

* Act as principal liaison for business stakeholders and as a key point-of-contact to technology services, internal/external agencies, and vendors on their behalf.
* Facilitate team understanding and elicit requirements for systems, integrations, and future state functionality.
* Partner with business stakeholders to identify problems/opportunities, assist in developing these into project/initiatives, and work within technology services to move these into the project pipeline.
* Understand business processes and system capabilities for complex, integrated systems.
* Work with vendors to understand system intricacies and process needs to advocate for the best possible solution.
* Utilize Azure Dev Ops (ADO) for all project tracking purposes.
* Create functional process fit/gap analysis documentation which identifies and recommends resolution of any process, system, and integration related gaps.
* Make suggestions for any as-is or to-be processes which are lacking and/or present a risk and help mitigate them, before they become an issue.
* Follow TS best practices: documentation, project, and change management processes.
* Collaborate with business stakeholders, technology services teams, internal/external agencies, vendors, et. al to support the organization’s mission, vision, and goals.

***Pay range: $60-$65/hr***

Link Technologies is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without discrimination based on race, color, religion, sex, gender identity/expression, sexual orientation, national origin, protected veteran status, disability, or any other factors protected by law.

Job Types: Full-time, Contract

Pay: $60.00 - $65.00 per hour

Expected hours: 40 per week

Benefits:

* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Vision insurance

title: Senior Business Analyst
description:
Graham Technologies is seeking a highly skilled Senior Business Analyst with deep expertise in Business Process Reengineering (BPR), systems requirements, and enterprise software development to support a mission-critical program within the Intelligence Community (IC). The ideal candidate will play a key role in bridging business needs and technical solutions, leading requirements documentation efforts, and ensuring software development aligns with enterprise goals. This role demands a hands-on, analytical professional capable of leading collaborative efforts across diverse teams, guiding technical solutions from concept through delivery, and ensuring alignment with stakeholder expectations.

**Location:** Reston, VA

**Key Responsibilities:**

* Apply systems engineering principles to define system and software requirements for enterprise applications.
* Perform complex analysis and research involving financial and acquisition systems, identifying inefficiencies and opportunities for improvement.
* Collaborate with stakeholders to gather and refine business and technical requirements, translating them into structured documentation.
* Develop process flows, workflow diagrams, and system interaction maps using tools like MS Visio to clearly communicate requirements.
* Lead Business Process Mapping and Analysis sessions to document current and future states of operations.
* Create detailed engineering design documentation that guides software development teams.
* Assist in the creation and execution of system test plans to validate functionality and performance of delivered solutions.
* Serve as a liaison between end users and technical teams to ensure all requirements are well-understood, documented, and implemented correctly.
* Conduct and facilitate requirements gathering sessions, user story workshops, and working group meetings.
* Monitor and manage risks, changes in scope, and project dependencies, delivering strategic recommendations to stakeholders.
* Provide regular reports and briefings to project stakeholders on requirements status, project health, and key deliverables.
* Lead pilot demonstrations and support User Acceptance Testing (UAT) efforts to validate end-user functionality.

**Required Skills:**

* Must possess active DoD Top Secret/SCI with CI Poly or ability to obtain a CI Poly
* Bachelor's degree in business, Computer Science, Systems Engineering, or a related field.
* 8+ years of relevant experience in systems/business analysis or related roles.
* Proven experience working on federal or IC programs, with preference given to candidates familiar with government acquisition and financial systems.
* Demonstrated experience in requirements gathering, documentation, and validation processes.
* Strong understanding of IT systems design, development, and engineering documentation.
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills, including experience presenting to executive stakeholders.
* Experience working in agileor hybrid environments with both government and contractor teams.
* Strong analytical, problem-solving, and customer service

**Preferred Skills:**

* Prior experience in a team leads or senior-level analytical role.
* Knowledge of business process management platforms.
* Familiarity with government acquisition and finance workflows.
* PMP (Project Management Professional)
* Proficiency in tools like JIRA, Confluence, or equivalent for requirement tracking

Compensation:

At Graham Technologies, we believe in treating everyone with fairness and respect. Our compensation package is designed to ensure fair pay for work, reflecting our commitment to integrity.

Many IT companies offer similar services, but what truly sets us apart is our people! We care deeply about our employees and consistently show our appreciation-not just for the final outcomes, but also for the effort and dedication shown every step of the way. Additionally, our generous benefits package supports our team members in living fulfilling and prosperous lives.

Here are just a few highlights of what we offer:

* Four Weeks of Accrued PTO in the First Year
* Eleven Paid Federal Holidays
* Comprehensive Health, Dental, Vision, and Life Insurance
* 401(k) Plan with Annual Employer Contributions
* Flexible Schedules
* Reimbursements for Continued Education and Training

Why Graham Technologies?

Our core values define who we are:

* Value our Customers
* Care about our Employees
* Passionate about Innovation
* Believe in a Strong Work Ethic
* Rely on Teamwork
* Integrity Matters

Founded in 2007, GTech is a consulting services firm passionate about delivering tailored solutions that meet our clients' needs and maximize the value of their investments. We achieve this by providing top-notch professionals across the IT industry. Our team embodies integrity, commitment, and reliability, which are at the heart of everything we do.

We are also dedicated to fostering a culture of support for our employees-the lifeblood of our business. At Graham Technologies, we've built a family-oriented environment where team members are encouraged to maintain a healthy work-life balance, pursue their passions, and grow professionally through flexible schedules, continued education, and a strong sense of community.
