title: Business Analyst Research and Insights - Greenville, SC (Hybrid)
description:
**Date:** Jun 18, 2025

**Location:** Greenville, SC, US, 29607Avon, CT, US, 06001-3689

**Company:** Hubbell Incorporated

**Job Overview**
----------------

A**re you ready to dive deep into the world of customer analytics and drive strategic decisions at Hubbell? We are looking for a dynamic Business Analyst to join our Revenue Operations team and play a pivotal role in understanding and enhancing our customer relationships.**

  

The Business Analyst - Customer Analytics, Research and Insights reports to Manager - Customer Analytics, Research and Insights, in Hubbell Revenue Operations. The Business Analyst is a key contributor to Hubbell Enterprise will help Hubbell to understand customer base; customer journey mapping, measures and metrics to learn satisfaction and lifetime value tracking of strategic customers and partners to Hubbell. The BA will lead detailed analytics leveraging tools such as Qualtrics, PowerBI, Survey Engines and other impactful analytical insights tools. The BA leverages data and analytics to inform on customer health, conduct customer end-market analyses, primary research, journey mapping and analyses and spearheads Revenue Operations viewpoint on trends and strategic planning. The BA presents data in a consolidated fashion to leaders and makes recommendations to help develop down line strategies and analytics. The BA will develop presentations for Hubbell Leadership understanding and decision making. The BA conducts qualitative studies - i.e., focus groups, customer panels, etc. The analysis is used to understand customer preferences, demographics, segmentation, decision making processes, customer journey and loyalty. The analysis may be used for Hubbell business planning and analysis.

**A Day In The Life**
---------------------

* Lead and execute all phases of customer journey mapping, persona development and behavior analytics.
* Oversee research and qualitative studies.
* Develop macro trends of customers, by markets, sectors and align this with Hubbell key go-to-market channels - i.e., distributors, utilities, end users, contractors, EPCs, etc.
* Collect and analyze data on customers for ongoing transactional viewpoint on experience, identifying trends and opportunities, as well as risks.
* Succinctly and effectively consolidate findings for presentation to senior management.
* Make strategic recommendations and partner with business leaders on key strategies based on data analysis.
* Develop advanced data models leveraging analytical tools.
* Drive insights and tool use.

**What will help you thrive in this role?**
-------------------------------------------

* Bachelor’s degree in Data Analytics, Digital Marketing Analytics, or a related field.
* At least 3-5 years of experience in a related analytics role; proficiency in analytical tools such as Power BI, and languages like DAX and SQL.
* Strong understanding of NPS, VOC, and other customer insight methodologies.
* Experience in marketing analytics, sales analytics, AI, and CX analytics is highly desirable.
* Demonstrated ability to thrive in environments characterized by agility and ambiguity.
* Proven track record as a self-starter who can work independently and collaboratively in a team environment. Excellent communication skills, capable of effectively presenting data insights and influencing decision making.

  

**Ready to make a significant impact and help shape the future of customer engagement at Hubbell? Apply now to join us as a Business Analyst in Customer Analytics, Research, and Insights! Let’s drive growth through deep customer understanding and innovative analytics.**

**Hubbell Incorporated**

  

Hubbell creates critical infrastructure solutions that power our customers, communities, people and the planet. Our company is strategically aligned around enabling grid modernization and electrification. As more products plug in to an aging grid, Hubbell solutions enable the transition to a more reliable, resilient and efficient energy infrastructure. Founded in 1888 our innovation has made us a leading global manufacturer of high quality electrical and utility solutions enabling customers to operate critical infrastructure reliably and efficiently.

  

The company operates in two segments. Hubbell Utility Solutions (HUS) enable the grid to conduct, communicate and control energy across utility applications and Hubbell Electrical Solutions (HES) are essential to managing power across a wide range of industries and applications. Our vertical market solutions can be applied to markets including Data Centers, Renewables, Commercial Buildings, Industrial, Telecom and Transportation. Supporting both of our business segments is our corporate and Hubbell Unified Business Solutions teams that provide consistent process, tools technologies across our businesses.

  

We are committed to operating sustainably and ethically while promoting an inclusive and supportive culture for our people to grow and develop in their careers. Our employees proudly work and serve our communities from our headquarters in Shelton, CT, across the United States and around the globe.

  

**Hubbell Unified Business Solutions**

  

Hubbell Unified Business Services (HUBS) provides corporate shared services to support all businesses across the enterprise. Functional areas include Engineering, Sales, Operations, Marketing, Finance, Legal, IT, Human Resources, Payroll, Environmental Health & Safety, and Compliance. HUBS employees are located around the world.

  

Hubbell Incorporated, its subsidiaries and affiliates, is an EO Employer AA: M/F/Veteran/Disability. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or any other protected class.
company_description: Hubbell Incorporated is an international manufacturer of quality electrical and electronic products for a broad range of applications.

title: SR. PRODUCT OWNER
description:
Our Senior Product Owners are key members of an Agile Product Management team responsible for driving innovation and value to the Transportation Planning Systems product line. The role is responsible for facilitating the collection of business needs from business owners and serves to understand and translate those needs into solutions. The primary focus is forward-looking by defining and communicating features and associated Objective & Key Results (OKRs) for the upcoming quarters using a product roadmap. The Senior Product Owner is also accountable for in-sprint delivery with close collaboration with the team Product Owner(s), when applicable. Additionally, the position tracks feature progress against the OKRs after releases.

  

The Senior Product Owner works with the IT scrum team to refine the features in the backlog for the next quarter, define and communicate priorities, and ensures the business needs are incorporated in the creation of user stories. The role commits user stories to the next 2 sprints during Sprint Planning and facilitates sprint demos to the business owners at the end of each sprint.

  

**Principal Duties:**

* Documents the purpose and benefit hypothesis for upcoming features in a charter
* Develops understanding and expertise of business area domain knowledge, objectives, and goals in order to facilitate solution requirements from business owners
* Collects business needs from the business owners
* Defines features and associated OKRs for the next quarter using the roadmap
* Refines features in the backlog for the next quarter
* Assigns business value in order to prioritize features based on data for the next quarter
* Accountable for quality of user stories to be completed and reviewed up to one week prior to Sprint Planning
* Accountable for the development of user stories for the next 2 sprints in Sprint Planning
* Escalates impediments as appropriate
* Coordinates and completes product testing for current sprint
* Facilitates sprint demos to business owners at the end of each sprint
* Facilitates sprint read-out/review to business owners at the start of each sprint to share outcome of Sprint Planning
* Coordinates change impacts, process, and change delivery with the business owners for a Change Management Plan for that release
* Provides Go/No Go decision for that release
* Tracks progress against OKRs for a 30-, 60-, and 90-day intervals after release
* Responsible for hiring process including candidate screening, interviewing, and hiring recommendations, when applicable
* Responsible for employee development including performance monitoring and evaluation, coaching, training, and mentoring

**Job Related Experience:**

* Minimum Level: 1-3 years

* Preferred Level: 2-5 years

**Education:**

* Preferred Level: Bachelor’s degree in business management, computer science or related field

**Technical Skills:**

* 2+ years of relevant product management, product owner or business analyst experience in an agile software product development environment

* 2+ years of experience delivering software with agile scrum methodologies and other commonly used tools

* Strong requirement facilitation skills and proven ability to write concisely and clearly for different audiences

* Strong business analytical skills with the capability of identifying, analyzing, and synthesizing product use data

* Ability to connect with leadership and technical and non-technical audiences effectively and efficiently while employing a high degree of collaboration and influence

**Skills and Abilities:**

* Oral & Written Communication

* Leadership

* Critical Thinking

* Prioritization

* Collaboration

* Analytical

* Candor

* Informed Risk-Taking

* Creativity

**Work Conditions:**

* Environment Hybrid (4 days in office; 1 day remote/week)

* Oncall: Yes

* Shift Work: No

* Travel Required: 0-2 days per Month

**Company Overview**

Since 1827, Norfolk Southern Corporation (NYSE: NSC) and its predecessor companies have safely moved the goods and materials that drive the U.S. economy. Today, it operates a customer-centric and operations-driven freight transportation network. Committed to furthering sustainability, Norfolk Southern helps its customers avoid 15 million tons of yearly carbon emissions by shipping via rail. Its dedicated team members deliver more than 7 million carloads annually, from agriculture to consumer goods, and is the largest rail shipper of auto products and metals in North America. Norfolk Southern also has the most extensive intermodal network in the eastern U.S., serving a majority of the country’s population and manufacturing base, with connections to every major container port on the Atlantic coast as well as the Gulf of Mexico and Great Lakes.

  

At Norfolk Southern, we believe in celebrating our individuality. By leveraging the unique backgrounds and viewpoints of our employees, we can create a culture of innovation, respect, and inclusion. We know that employees thrive in a workplace where differing viewpoints, ideas, and experiences are freely shared and valued. As such, we encourage all employees to contribute their distinctive skills and capabilities to our organization.

  

**Equal employment opportunities are available to all applicants regardless of race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetic information, veteran status, sexual orientation, and gender identity. Together, we power progress.**
company_addresses: 650 W Peachtree St NW, Atlanta, GA 30308

title: Business Analyst (Mid/Senior)
description:
Company Description

**Join us and make YOUR mark on the World!**

Are you interested in joining some of the brightest talent in the world to strengthen the United States’ security? Come join Lawrence Livermore National Laboratory (LLNL) where our employees apply their expertise to create solutions for BIG ideas that make our world a better place.

We are dedicated to fostering a culture that values individuals, talents, partnerships, ideas, experiences, and different perspectives, recognizing their importance to the continued success of the Laboratory’s mission.

**Pay Range**  
$93,090 - $113,988 Annually at the E01.2 level  
$111,600 - $136,656 Annually at the E01.3 level  
This is the lowest to highest salary we in good faith believe we would pay for this role at the time of this posting. An employee’s position within the salary range will be based on several factors including, but not limited to, specific competencies, relevant education, qualifications, certifications, experience, skills, seniority, geographic location, performance, and business or organizational needs.

Job Description

We have an opening for a **Business Analyst** to support the financial processes and product improvement strategies in the Office of the Chief Financial Officer (CFO). You will be matrixed to support functional customers and systems in Finance. You will be responsible for partnering with functional area subject matter experts, learning their business processes, identifying strategies for improvement, and developing and executing implementation plans. Our Financial applications span accounts payable, travel accounting, payroll, and TIME and are supported using Oracle EBS, ePay/Infor, OnBase, Service Now, Jira, and Peoplesoft 9.2. You will report to the Help Desk, Analyze & Test Systems (HATS), Team Leader.

*This position may offer a hybrid schedule, which includes the flexibility to work from home one or more days per week, after a probationary period. The specifics of the hybrid schedule, including the exact number of days required in the office and virtual work options may vary based on the needs of the team and the organization.*

**You will**

* Coordinate efforts for the system process improvements and help to ensure all action items are added, tracked, and reported out on a regular basis.
* Assist in gathering project documentation and quality requirements. Partner with functional experts to understand and analyze current business processes and workflows, develop alternative approaches, and facilitate implementation of new or enhanced business and technical solutions.
* Monitor tasks to include internal and external deliverables and ensure responsibly parties are completing activities on time to support closure.
* Research and prepare documentation for user guides, training manuals, and process checklists for disbursement systems.
* Develop system test strategies and plans, perform system testing and create and execute automated test scripts in support of Disbursement application maintenance tasks and projects.
* Gather performance data, assist in analysis, and make recommendations that may include schedule variance analysis and preparation of recovery or corrective action plans.
* Perform SharePoint site administration and maintain organized shared document structures.
* Communicate effectively between leadership and the functional teams. Provide consultative support to Disbursement leadership team to monitor deliverables and tracked action items.
* Assist in the development of programmatic documents such as reports, decision memos, external responses, and action items.
* Perform initial analysis of requests to change, add or enhance existing processes or system functionality, engaging a variety of functional and IT stakeholders as appropriate. Analyze the impacts of change requests, effort needed to implement, and disposition as a bug fix, enhancement, or project with a recommended priority level.
* Conduct assessments of current processes and identify improvement opportunities.
* Perform other duties as assigned.

**Additional job responsibilities, at the E01.3 level**

* Lead cross-functional process improvement project teams, gather and translate complex user requirements, deliver process streamlining methodologies, make recommendations for new system strategies, and communicate solutions to stakeholders.
* Perform complex analysis to assess and identify opportunities to improve functional process or system performance. Develop and implement strategies for addressing process gaps.
* Be responsible for end-to-end process maps and create or enhance existing process documentation and mapping.
* Serve as the Product Owner for assigned application to provide in-depth consultation, partnering with functional experts and IT to set a vision that informs technology roadmap prioritization and backlog.
* Present solutions to senior business stakeholders and technical staff that identify requirements and industry best-practice solutions to enhance the efficiency and integrity of Finance systems. Create fit/gap analysis presentations that help facilitate Finance product decisions.
* Write test plans and conduct test cases for system implementations, upgrades, or enhancements.
* Train and mentor others in the development of self-service products and training materials. Conduct training and end-user engagement sessions designed to improve system adoption.

Qualifications

* Ability to secure and maintain a U.S. DOE Q-level security clearance which requires U.S. citizenship.
* Bachelor’s degree in Business or Technology area or equivalent combination of education and related experience.
* Knowledge and understanding of financial systems & processes and extensive knowledge of distribution systems. Experience gathering, analyzing, evaluating, and interpreting data for documenting functional needs and constraints.
* Experience in project management, coordinating workflow activities in a dynamic work environment, and ability to meet deadlines and manage changing priorities.
* Experience effectively applying good judgment, discretion, and problem-solving skills to identify solutions and resolve issues.
* Proficiency in working effectively as part of a multi-disciplinary team in a business support environment using computer systems to manage complex data collections. Ability to use discretion and problem-solving skills to resolve issues.
* Effective organizational skills and ability to communicate clear expectations on project and process activities, as well as lead the facilitation of business process improvements.
* Advanced experience using MS Office business applications and web-based collaborative platforms, such as Confluence, Teams, Word, Excel, Visio. Experience using Adobe Acrobat Pro, Microsoft Teams and ability to learn new software applications.

**Additional qualifications at the E01.3 level**

* Significant experience analyzing current business processes and systems for efficiencies, cost reductions and streamlining of operations.
* Experience developing business process documentation and training materials.
* Knowledge and understanding of financial business principles, regulatory requirements, process efficiency concepts, industry best practices, and standards implementation.
* Experience writing test plans and conducting test cases for system implementations, upgrades, or enhancements.
* Experience performing data analysis, developing metrics to assess functional performance and usage of report information to continually improve reporting capabilities.
* Significant communication skills are necessary to interact effectively with multi-disciplinary team members and negotiation skills to influence outcomes.
* Experience working effectively both independently and as a member of a team.

**Qualifications We Desire**

* Cross functional finance work experience, preferably in accounts payable.
* Functional knowledge of ImageSoft and OCR products, Financial EBS systems and technology, preferably Oracle, ImageSoft, ServiceNow, or Jira, Oracle, SQL and TOAD
* Experience working in Shared Services or providing help desk support to business systems.
* Experience supporting ERP transformation and business process re-engineering, Agile Methodologies for software development and project management.
* Significant project management experience preparing project plans including task estimation, dependencies, and deployment schedules including interacting with internal resources to complete required project activities.

Additional Information

#LI-Hybrid

**Position Information**

This is a Career Indefinite position, open to Lab employees and external candidates.

**Why Lawrence Livermore National Laboratory?**

* Included in 2025 Best Places to Work by Glassdoor!
* Flexible Benefits Package
* 401(k)
* Relocation Assistance
* Education Reimbursement Program
* Flexible schedules (\\*depending on project needs)
* Our values - visit https://www.llnl.gov/inclusion/our-values

**Security Clearance**

This position requires a Department of Energy (DOE) Q-level clearance. If you are selected, we will initiate a Federal background investigation to determine if you meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information or matter. Also, all L or Q cleared employees are subject to random drug testing. Q-level clearance requires U.S. citizenship.

**Pre-Employment Drug Test**

External applicant(s) selected for this position must pass a post-offer, pre-employment drug test. This includes testing for use of marijuana as Federal Law applies to us as a Federal Contractor.

**Wireless and Medical Devices**

Per the Department of Energy (DOE), Lawrence Livermore National Laboratory must meet certain restrictions with the use and/or possession of mobile devices in Limited Areas. Depending on your job duties, you may be required to work in a Limited Area where you are not permitted to have a personal and/or laboratory mobile device in your possession. This includes, but not limited to cell phones, tablets, fitness devices, wireless headphones, and other Bluetooth/wireless enabled devices.

If you use a medical device, which pairs with a mobile device, you must still follow the rules concerning the mobile device in individual sections within Limited Areas. Sensitive Compartmented Information Facilities require separate approval. Hearing aids without wireless capabilities or wireless that has been disabled are allowed in Limited Areas, Secure Space and Transit/Buffer Space within buildings.

**How to identify fake job advertisements**

Please be aware of recruitment scams where people or entities are misusing the name of Lawrence Livermore National Laboratory (LLNL) to post fake job advertisements. LLNL never extends an offer without a personal interview and will never charge a fee for joining our company. All current job openings are displayed on the Career Page under “Find Your Job” of our website. If you have encountered a job posting or have been approached with a job offer that you suspect may be fraudulent, we strongly recommend you do not respond.

To learn more about recruitment scams: https://www.llnl.gov/sites/www/files/2023-05/LLNL-Job-Fraud-Statement-Updated-4.26.23.pdf

**Equal Employment Opportunity**

We are an equal opportunity employer that is committed to providing all with a work environment free of discrimination and harassment. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, marital status, national origin, ancestry, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, protected veteran status, age, citizenship, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws.

**Reasonable Accommodation**

Our goal is to create an accessible and inclusive experience for all candidates applying and interviewing at the Laboratory. If you need a reasonable accommodation during the application or the recruiting process, please use our online form to submit a request.

**California Privacy Notice**

The California Consumer Privacy Act (CCPA) grants privacy rights to all California residents. The law also entitles job applicants, employees, and non-employee workers to be notified of what personal information LLNL collects and for what purpose. The Employee Privacy Notice can be accessed here.
company_description: Lawrence Livermore National Lab - We use science and technology to make the world a safer place.

title: Business Analyst 1 Internet
description:
Overview:

We are seeking a full-time **Internet Business Analyst 1** in our Olathe, KS location. In this role, you will be responsible for gathering, documenting, and communicating user requirements for small to medium size projects of average complexity.

Responsibilities:

**Essential Functions**

* Work closely with project team including product owner to ensure requirements are understood and deliverables are aligned with project objectives
* Demonstrate understanding of business analysis principles/methodologies and apply them to development of basic user requirements
* Manage user requirements for small to medium size projects of average complexity
* Identify basic discrepancies and conflicts in project requirements
* Assist in resolving missing or conflicting requirements of basic scope among multiple stakeholders
* Offer suggestions to improve business processes to the product owner and IT business analysis processes to more experienced Business Analyst
* Execute plan made by supervisor or mentor and may plan own documentation and analysis
* Thoroughly document work in organized manner in accordance with Garmin and IT standards
* Applies standards and procedures to accomplish tasks and learns how to use and apply appropriate tools as needed
* Attends and actively participates in department and facility meetings and classes
* Demonstrates commitment to quality through knowledge of its precepts, skillful workplace applications and continuous organizational improvement
* Demonstrate responsibility for ongoing personal development, professional growth, and continuing education
* Work with project Product Owner to document requirements using use cases, scenarios, business, and workflow analysis that align with project objectives
* Decompose high-level information into detailed user stories and abstract up from low-level information to general understanding of business needs
* Collaborate directly with co-located and remote development team and business clients

* Demonstrated ability to learn how to use and apply applicable technologies
* Demonstrates understanding of business analysis principles and methodologies and capability to apply that knowledge to effectively accomplish essential functions of role
* Understands importance of thoroughly documenting work in an organized manner
* Demonstrated strong and effective verbal, written, and interpersonal communication skills
* Demonstrated ability to complete well defined basic tasks and/or projects
* Identifies and resolves problems of basic scope using proper tools and techniques

**Desired Qualifications**

* Outstanding academics (cumulative GPA greater than or equal to 3.5)
* Knowledge of current web technologies
* Knowledge of project management methodologies including Agile
* Knowledge of basic database concepts
* Knowledge of automated testing tools and testing procedures
* International communications experience

*Garmin International is an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, citizenship, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, veteran’s status, age or disability.*

title: Senior Digital Services Business Analyst
description:
Overview:

Under the leadership of the SVP of Digital Service Engineering, the Sr Digital Services Business Analyst will play a pivotal role in the definition of solutions for Ontrak Health.

This role is responsible for solving cross-functional organizational problems through identification and presentation of business and technical specifications based on customer and business needs, industry best practices and available technology. The ideal candidate for this role has a blend of business and technical skills, with significant healthcare experience, including delivery of health programs operational functions through digital service solutions. The Sr DS Business Analyst will work across the organization to define the functional, usability, reliability, performance, and support requirements of end-to-end system solutions, providing a link between the business and technical views of the system to ensure the solutions being developed will satisfy the needs of the business.

Essential Functions:

* Solve problems by identifying and refining solutions in a complex digital services environment by independently driving requirement documentation, defining scope and priorities, and removing blockers to ensure on time delivery of solutions.
* You will use your strong analysis skills to determine when enhancements or new solutions are needed, define the solutions across multiple systems, and/or business processes. With the support of the DS Engineering team, your key mission will be to define, build and deploy solutions across multiple systems for our business operations teams.
* You will provide daily guidance to the team to facilitate clear understanding of solution deliverables, while working to build strong relationships and communication pathways with stakeholders to ensure that we have continuous alignment of priorities across all Ontrak Health. You will be the glue that connects the Ontrak health business team with our DS Engineering team.
* Ensure that as a Digital Services Engineering team we are meeting our implementation commitments and timelines. That we have the successful deployment and adoption of solutions.
* You will be passionate about keeping the backlog well groomed, refined, and scoped for prioritization in advance of sprint planning.
* Define and document technology and business solutions using use cases, process mapping, functional process workflows, test scripts, and other visual models that describe highly complex abstract development requirements. You’ll be constantly working to connect technical and functional requirements to business objectives and KPIs, to support the Ontrak Mission.
* Support development team, and configuration team by being the glue for an overall technical solution and go-to person. You will take ownership of the overall goal and drive to meet or exceed delivery expectations by maintenance and grooming the DevOps backlog and support building the Ontrak DS Roadmap.
* Facilitate requirement or problem-solving conversations that lead to a fun and engaging work environment; Be willing to jump in as the ring master on daily standups or change control review meetings. Be lively about driving to next steps, and continuously pushing improve our current state and expect similar results from those around you.

*Compensation range: 130,000 - 140,000*

Qualifications:

Required: Bachelor’s degree

Preferred: Master’s degree

Equivalent: in lieu of degree, equivalent education and/or experience may be considered.

Required Experience:

* 5+ plus years of experience in business analysis or product management with experience on medium to large-scale digital business solutions
* Experience delivering solutions using Agile Methodologies, and frameworks.
* Ability to work in a self-directed manner with minimal direction and oversight.
* Extremely detail oriented and can drive solutions proactively for work related issues.
* Experience with Behavioral Health, Health Insurance and Digital Product Solutions including but not limited to knowledge of healthcare claims and enrollment systems both from a user and configuration perspective – Netsmart, MyEvolv experience a plus.
* Ability to drive positive results in difficult circumstances with ability to cope with rapid change.
* Ability to multi-task effectively and efficiently
* Knowledge and experience of SDLC, proven track record of delivery and execution of projects.
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills required, including a thorough understanding of how to interpret customer business needs and translate them into application and operational requirements.

Required Skills:

* Analytical Skills/Problem solving skills - Ability to use thinking and reasoning to solve a problem.
* Execution and Delivery – Able to meet commitments and deliver solutions that have an impact both within Ontrak and with our Ontrak Members.
* Detail Oriented - Ability to pay attention to the minute details of a project or task.
* Strong communication skills both Oral and Written
* Organized - Possessing the trait of being organized or following a systematic method of performing a task.
* Accuracy - Ability to perform work accurately and thoroughly.
* Accountability - Ability to accept responsibility and account for his/her actions.
* Familiarity with healthcare data and regulatory protections.
* Experience with Agile Processes and SDLC Delivery
* Proficiency using Microsoft Office applications required (including MS Visio, Excel, SharePoint) and data query tools (SQL)

About Us:

**Ontrakhealth. is making a positive impact on people’s lives every day.** Ontrak is a value-based behavioral healthcare company that identifies and engages people with unmet health needs using our proprietary Advanced Engagement System to improve clinical outcomes and reduce total cost of care.

**Excellent compensation**  
In addition to a competitive wage, we offer comprehensive benefits including medical, dental and vision insurance; a 401(k) plan; paid holiday, vacation and sick time; flexible spending accounts; Basic Life/AD&D, Employee Assistance Program and Travel Assistance Program and more.

Join Ontrakhealth Team!

*Ontrak, Inc. is an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or protected veteran status.*

title: Analyst, Growth and Global GTM (Sales Operations)
description:
**Who We Are**
--------------

AeroVect is transforming ground handling with autonomy, redefining how airlines and ground service providers around the globe run day-to-day operations. We are a Series A company backed by top-tier venture capital investors in aviation and autonomous driving. Our customers include some of the world’s largest airlines and ground handling providers. For more information, visit www.aerovect.com.

**What You'll Do**
------------------

Positioned at the crossroads of sales, marketing, and product, you'll equip our commercial team with world-class collateral (customer-facing materials/sales assets) and keep every deal advancing on schedule.

* **Build customer-facing collateral** – own first drafts of pitch decks, technical briefs, RFP responses, tenders, feasibility studies, ROI models, and case studies.
* **Contract support** – assemble redlines, track versions, coordinate with Legal and Finance to keep MSAs, SOWs, NDAs, and POs moving on schedule.
* **Sales operations** – update CRM, maintain content library, and ensure the latest slide, spec sheet, or pricing model is always at the team’s fingertips.
* **Customer communication & calls** – join and lead prospect and customer calls throughout the sales cycle (often hundreds per engagement); draft crisp emails, schedule meetings, and represent AeroVect with impeccable judgment so every next step is crystal-clear.
* **Project-manage long sales cycles** – help manage timelines for customer engagements, chase internal reviews, and surface bottlenecks before they cost us a quarter.

**What Makes You a Fit**
------------------------

* 1-3 years in management consulting or investment banking.
* World-class at PowerPoint and Excel; you build models and slides at break-neck speed with zero typos
* Not afraid to speak up and stand firm to keep fellow team members on track and accountable to timelines
* Solid grasp of contract structures and sophisticated contract / legal intuition
* Ruthless attention to detail and ability to track 15 open items simultaneously
* Bias for action; you ship the draft while others are still discussing the outline and you track 15 open items simultaneously
* Clear, concise written and verbal communication
* Passion for aviation and enterprise sales
* Familiarity with CRM hygiene and sales-enablement tooling.

*New York City is preferred; exceptional remote candidates (US time zones) considered.*

Compensation Range: $100K - $150K

title: Sr. Financial Analyst Business Partner
description:
**Division Information**

Spectrum Brands’ global enabling functions, including Finance, Legal, IT, Human Resources, Supply Chain, and Commercial Operations, provide enterprise-wide strategy, structure, and common processes to deliver the knowledge and expertise that helps our businesses grow. Enabling functions may operate as a center-led global team, providing a central strategy, structure, and standards; or as business partner teams, with resources embedded within the businesses to deliver business unit-specific results.

 **Job Summary**

The Global Supply Chain Senior Finance Analyst is a strategic and high impact contributor role that supports strategic and financial initiatives across the global supply chain. This role will support supply chain financial practices for budgeting, tracking of inflation, cost savings and other business metrics. In addition, the role will assist the Supply Chain organization in all financial analysis related to Supply Chain cost tracking and improvements.

 **Primary Duties & Responsibilities**  

Analytical (40%)

* Provide regular consolidated global financial reporting for all key supply chain metrics to the center led Supply Chain team.
* Lead the budgeting and forecasting processes for the Inbound Supply Chain team.
* Coordinate with various BUs and regions to support standardization of reporting and analysis across the platform.
* Ensure monthly actual supply chain financial results are synchronized across various platforms and reporting. Investigate differences and make corrections to ensure perfect accuracy.
* Provide and gather data to ensure accurate supply chain financial reporting. Independently perform analysis on freight financial results. Explain variances and highlight opportunities for expense reductions.
* Lead and document analysis and consolidation of overall global freight rates by contract/spot, mode, lane, and business, managing a spend of over 100 million US.
* Partners closely with the supply chain team to support key productivity initiatives, including validation of savings and correlating key metrics to financial performance.

Reporting (40%):

* Develop standard report formats and collect data from a diverse user base using a diverse set of financial software applications.
* Create reports from multiple source data sets using SAP SAC-P and MS Excel.
* Consolidate and publish monthly/quarterly supply chain financial reports and help support businesses in researching explanations of results and variances from expectations/forecasts.
* Facilitate and support monthly reporting to review financials with Business Unit Senior Leadership teams. Publish reports for senior management in Excel, PowerPoint, and Adobe pdf.
* Help drive continuous process improvement in supply chain financial reporting and analysis within Strategic Finance & Enterprise Reporting team and for businesses.
* Support the initiatives to organize multi-dimensional databases for Supply Chain reporting using SQL and SAP BPC functionalities.
* Lead and Engage with the Corp Supply Chain team and the Enterprise reporting team to enhance global supply chain reporting capabilities by utilizing latest BI tools.

Support and other ad hoc activities (20%)

* Support reporting by coordinating with all the BUs/regions and the various enabling functions with corporate shared services.
* Develops ad hoc financial reports at the request of management to support the analysis of supply chain trends and handle escalations.
* Other duties as assigned.

  
**Education and Experience Profile**  

* Bachelor’s degree required. Accounting or Finance degree preferred. MBA/CPA a plus.
* 5+ years of heavily weighted analytics experience in finance and accounting.
* Experience in systems and business analysis.
* Experience in leading in a cross-functional team environment.

 **Required Skills**  

* Frequent interaction with the Divisional Vice President of Distribution & Transportation and with the Global Vice President of Supply Chain.
* Knowledge of and experience with multi-dimensional database building and maintenance.
* Works independently with limited supervision.
* Ability to lead process improvement projects within function.
* Provide financial direction and decision support to the Divisional Vice President and the Global Vice President of Supply Chain, as they influence the different business units in managing inbound, outbound, and direct distribution expense.
* Provide financial fact-based decision support for strategic direction on supply chain projects.
* Skill working with large quantities of data in Microsoft Excel Pivot Tables is required.
* Detail oriented with a thorough attention to details with numbers and systems.
* Ability to multi-task effectively.
* Demonstrated ability to present analysis to management.
* Proficient level of analytical interpretation

  
**Work Environment**

Working conditions are normal for an office environment.

The above information on this description has been designed to indicate the general nature and level of work performed by employees within this job/classification. It is not designed to contain or be interpreted as a comprehensive inventory of all duties, responsibilities, and qualifications required of employees assigned to this job.

Spectrum Brands is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer.

*#LI-LM1 #LI-Hybrid*

  
Job Reference: US19585

title: Process Expert II
description:
**Process Expert II**

**Location: Hybrid 1**: *This role requires associates to be in-office* ***1-2*** *days per week, fostering collaboration and connectivity, while providing flexibility to support productivity and work-life balance. This approach combines structured office engagement with the autonomy of virtual work, promoting a dynamic and adaptable workplace. Alternate locations may be considered.*

*Schedule: 8:00AM - 4:30PM EST,* employees will be required for weekend rotation (8a-6p EST Sat/Sun) once a month, night time rotation (Mon-Fri 1p-930p EST) once a month, Holiday rotation.

The **Process Expert II** supports a single operations department by participating in project and process work.

**How you will make an impact:**

* Researches operations workflow problems and system irregularities; develops tests, presents process improvement solutions for new systems, new accounts and other operational improvements; develops and leads project plans and communicates project status.

**Minimum Requirements**:

* Requires a BA/BS and minimum of 5 years experience in business analysis, process improvement, project coordination in a high-volume managed care operation (claims, customer service, enrollment and billing); or any combination of education and experience, which would provide an equivalent background.

**Preferred Skills, Capabilities, and Experiences:**

* Ability to analyze workflows, processes, supporting systems and procedures and identifying improvements strongly preferred.
* Associates in this role are expected to have strong oral, written and interpersonal communication skills, problem-solving skills, facilitation skills, and analytical skills.

Who We Are

Elevance Health is a health company dedicated to improving lives and communities – and making healthcare simpler. We are a Fortune 25 company with a longstanding history in the healthcare industry, looking for leaders at all levels of the organization who are passionate about making an impact on our members and the communities we serve.

How We Work

At Elevance Health, we are creating a culture that is designed to advance our strategy but will also lead to personal and professional growth for our associates. Our values and behaviors are the root of our culture. They are how we achieve our strategy, power our business outcomes and drive our shared success - for our consumers, our associates, our communities and our business.

We offer a range of market-competitive total rewards that include merit increases, paid holidays, Paid Time Off, and incentive bonus programs (unless covered by a collective bargaining agreement), medical, dental, vision, short and long term disability benefits, 401(k) +match, stock purchase plan, life insurance, wellness programs and financial education resources, to name a few.

Elevance Health operates in a Hybrid Workforce Strategy. Unless specified as primarily virtual by the hiring manager, associates are required to work at an Elevance Health location at least once per week, and potentially several times per week. Specific requirements and expectations for time onsite will be discussed as part of the hiring process.

The health of our associates and communities is a top priority for Elevance Health. We require all new candidates in certain patient/member-facing roles to become vaccinated against COVID-19 and Influenza. If you are not vaccinated, your offer will be rescinded unless you provide an acceptable explanation. Elevance Health will also follow all relevant federal, state and local laws.

Elevance Health is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, citizenship status, color, creed, disability, ethnicity, genetic information, gender (including gender identity and gender expression), marital status, national origin, race, religion, sex, sexual orientation, veteran status or any other status or condition protected by applicable federal, state, or local laws. Applicants who require accommodation to participate in the job application process may contact elevancehealthjobssupport@elevancehealth.com for assistance.

Qualified applicants with arrest or conviction records will be considered for employment in accordance with all federal, state, and local laws, including, but not limited to, the Los Angeles County Fair Chance Ordinance and the California Fair Chance Act.

title: AVP I, Data Engineering
description:
### **Position Summary**

One of America's leading issuers of VISA® and MasterCard® credit cards in Las Vegas, Nevada, is seeking highly qualified Information Management professionals. We provide credit cards to individuals other banks have historically overlooked because of their less-than-perfect credit. With millions of people carrying our credit cards, we pride ourselves on excellent customer service and various credit card products with innovative features.

This position is a part of the Data Strategy, Governance, and Analytics group. This team is based in the Information Management department and supports the entire bank. The mission of the data analytics and reporting team is to take the enterprise from its current state of analytics to be more predictive and prescriptive using advanced analytical techniques. Our goal is to analyze a large volume of data using advanced analytics to find trends and answer questions to support business processes and systems. Our data professionals are tasked with creating efficient data analysis pipelines, data mining, statistical analysis and creating powerful visualizations to support the business in their day-to-day decision making.

The AVP of Data Strategy & Governance is a subject matter expert in data analytics and business analysis. They will lead a team of data engineers to perform analysis, design, optimization activities and deliver analytical solutions in support of analytical needs of the business across Credit One Bank. They also play a critical role in defining and creating the future state of data and analytics in the enterprise. Team members are expected to build trust and relationships through effective communication with both technical and non-technical partners within multiple departments to facilitate success. A successful individual in this role is a leader who contributes to the organization/departmental goals and leads the team to achieve these goals. They mentor and coaches the team in business processes, data discovery, designing efficient, optimized analytical solutions, identifies opportunities to add value to the business and ensures on-time delivery of projects. They identify ways to keep their team motivated and deliver high value projects.

### **Summary of Essential Job Functions**

* Manages, coaches, and mentors a team of data engineers responsible for delivering strategic initiatives to provide insights for timely, data-driven decisions to the business stakeholders.
* Leads design discussions with the team to support the development, deployment, testing, and maintenance of high-quality and optimal solutions related to data analysis, data discovery, data pipeline automation, and roll-out of compelling visualizations for business analysis.
* Possesses solid conceptual knowledge of department tools and applications.
* Guides and coaches the team to explore diverse source systems to discover data elements and understand business processes to design high value analytical solutions.
* Serves as an expert consultant to internal technical and line of business teams.
* Act as a primary contact for the business partner team for work prioritization, project sizing, resource allocation, delivery timelines, quality control, process map adherence, escalations, and project communication.
* Follows agile methodology to deliver analytical solutions and manages JIRA for all deliverables to the business.
* Leads conversations on project requirements, develops roadmaps, and provides project progress visibility to partner team executives and senior executives.
* Leads strategic conversations, presents ideas, results, recommendations, and roadmaps to business stakeholders and executives.
* Recruits new talent, ensures team’s continuous technical development, and addresses any existing skill gaps.
* Anticipate issues based on knowledge of internal data trends and propose solutions.
* Defines and documents departmental processes and standards.
* Leads projects to support modernization and innovation within the team.
* Ensures that work and processes are well documented.
* Performs other duties as assigned.

### **Position Requirements**

* Bachelor’s Degree in Business, Mathematics, Statistics, Engineering, Computer Science, or related field
* 7+ years of experience in business analysis, quantitative analytics, data science; preferably within the financial services industry
* 6+ years of advanced experience using SQL (SQL Server, Oracle, Teradata etc.), data visualization (Tableau, Power BI etc.,), data integration (SSIS, Alteryx, Talend etc.,) and at least one analytical package such as SAS, Python, R, etc.
* 2+ years of experience managing a team of analytical professionals.
* Organizational and prioritization skills to manage multiple, competing priorities
* Leadership skills to manage and mentor a team of analytical professionals across varying levels of skill and experience.
* Excellent communication skills - and ability to thrive in a fast-paced complex environment
* Experience developing requirements and testing analytic solutions collaboratively
* Self-starter who is highly motivated, collaborative, and innovative.
* Stays current with relevant technology advancements in the financial industry.
* Demonstrate company core values of excellence, ownership, collaboration, and integrity.
* Knowledge of financial analysis, credit, profitability drivers as well as operational analytics

### **Preferred**

* Graduate degree in quantitative area such as mathematics, economics, engineering, computer science, operations research and equivalent industry experience
* Strong financial analytical skills with the ability to read, interpret, and evaluate, financial time-series tracking reports (including vintage analysis).

Credit One Bank, N.A. is a data-driven financial services company based in Las Vegas. Founded in 1984, Credit One Bank offers various credit card products for people in all financial life stages. Credit One Bank is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion and does not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of age, race, religion, color, disability, sex, sexual orientation, or national origin. Reasonable accommodations can be made for those who require them, including access to job applications and workplace accommodations. Employment at Credit One Bank is based on mutual consent (also known as at-will). Employees and the Bank may terminate the employment relationship at any time, with or without cause or notice. Please get in touch with the recruiter for this position to learn more. Credit One Bank does not accept unsolicited resumes from agencies and is not responsible for related fees.
