title: Capital Development Analyst New
description:
**Capital Development Analyst**
-------------------------------

**Location:** Hoboken, NJ (On-Site)

**Team:** Capital Development

**Reports To:** Capital Development Leadership

  

### **About Faropoint:**

**Meaningful Relationships. Ownership. Curiosity. Tenacity.**

These are the four pillars that drive Faropoint—one of the fastest-growing industrial real estate private equity firms and a top-50 industrial owner in the U.S. We are relationship-oriented, data-driven, and committed to evolving how capital is raised and deployed in the industrial real estate space.

  

### **About the Role:**

We’re looking for a **Capital Development Analyst** to join our Capital Development team in Hoboken. This is a **hands-on operational role** focused on the systems, data, and workflows that power our capital development efforts. You’ll be responsible for keeping our Salesforce CRM clean and actionable, logging and summarizing key meetings, supporting coordination efforts, and most importantly—identifying where **technology and AI** can streamline and improve what we do every day.

Your work will be **central to enabling the team** to function at its best. We’re looking for someone who is **structured, thoughtful, and proactive**, with a strong desire to bring **efficiency and automation** to everything they touch.

  

### **Key Responsibilities:**

#### **CRM and Data Management**

* Own the upkeep and organization of the **Salesforce CRM**, including investor records, opportunity tracking, and status updates.
* Log meeting notes and action items promptly, ensuring accuracy and completeness.
* Generate reports and dashboards to help the team stay aligned on follow-ups and priorities.

  

#### **Meeting Support & Internal Coordination**

* Attend internal capital development meetings to document discussions, summarize next steps, and support team alignment.
* Work with executive assistants and other team members to help schedule, prepare for, and track progress across internal capital-related initiatives.
* Assist with compiling information for investor materials when needed, though not client-facing.

  

#### **Process Improvement & Automation**

* Identify repetitive or manual tasks in day-to-day workflows—and suggest or implement ways to **automate** them using tools like **ChatGPT, Zapier, or Notion AI**.
* Develop and refine **AI prompts and templates** to improve team productivity (e.g., email drafting, meeting recaps, status summaries).
* Collaborate with internal stakeholders to test and scale automation initiatives without disrupting business operations.

  

#### **Research & Project Support**

* Conduct light research to support capital development strategies (e.g., conference intelligence, competitor insights).
* Assist in organizing internal knowledge and reference materials for future use.

  

### **About You:**

#### **Mindset & Approach**

* You think in systems: you notice inefficiencies and instinctively look for ways to improve them.
* You take pride in operational excellence—accuracy, follow-through, and clean data matter to you.
* You enjoy working behind the scenes to make processes run better and faster.

  

#### **Qualifications**

* Bachelor’s degree in Business, Finance, Economics, or another analytical or operational discipline.
* 1–3 years of experience in operations, business analysis, investor support, capital markets, or a related function.
* Experience working in a CRM platform (preferably Salesforce), including managing data and building reports.
* Clear and concise written communication skills, especially for summarizing meetings and writing process documentation.

  

#### **Technical and AI Proficiency**

* Demonstrated experience with **AI tools** (e.g., ChatGPT, Notion AI, Claude) and prompt writing for structured tasks.
* Familiarity with **workflow tools** like Zapier, Airtable Automations, or Google Apps Script is a plus.
* Comfortable learning and applying new technologies to real business use cases.

  

### **Why Join Us:**

This is a role for someone who finds satisfaction in being the engine room of a high-performing team—**where clarity, consistency, and automation matter more than visibility**. You’ll be supported by colleagues who value systems thinkers and given room to introduce smart changes that make the whole team more effective.

  

#### **Compensation:**

* This position offers a base salary in the $75,000-$115,000 range, plus discretionary bonus, competitive healthcare benefits, unlimited PTO, and a 401k match.

**Equal Opportunity Employer:**

Faropoint is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. We value diversity, and we do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, parental status, disability status, or any other status protected by local law. We believe that our work is better and our company culture is improved when we encourage, support, and respect the different skills and experiences represented within our workforce.

title: Business Systems Analyst
description:
An exciting career awaits you

At MPC, we’re committed to being a great place to work – one that welcomes new ideas, encourages diverse perspectives, develops our people, and fosters a collaborative team environment.

Position Summary

As a Business Systems Analyst within the Finance IT – Risk Management team, you will have the opportunity to gain exposure and add value to various risk management related functions within MPC, including our Enterprise Risk Management, Audit Assurance & Advisory Services, SOX, and Compliance functions. Other focused areas of risk within larger MPC functions are also in scope for the IT Risk Management team and include areas such as credit risk evaluation, supplier risk evaluation, and centralized organizational and financial, policy-driven authority management. The team operates in a cross-functional manner leveraging an agile methodology for work management.

Key Responsibilities

* Manages the definition of business processes in order to measure, analyze, improve and control the process being reviewed.
* Communicates effectively with the business/stakeholders and development teams to gain an understanding of business partners’ functional and non-functional requirements, provide feedback, and communicate changes.
* Develop recommendations for appropriate systems, alternatives and/or enhancements to current systems.
* Performs continuous, iterative exploration and investigation of business performance and other measures to gain insight and drive business planning.
* Performs cost-benefit analyses for proposed systems to aid management in making implementation decisions.
* Supports implementation of ways to improve working processes in the team.
* Supports monitoring the execution of basic IT service management practices around incident, Change, Problem and Solution Development Lifecycle (SDLC) delivery methodologies including basic configuration tasks.
* Coordinates test case development, execution, and support strategy creation for technology delivery.
* Plans, conduct and documents user stories, user feedback to support development of prototypes and wireframes.

Education and Experience

* Bachelor’s Degree in Information Systems preferred, related field or equivalent experience.
* 2+ years of relevant experience required
* Experience with Archer or AuditBoard is preferred.
* Experience with ServiceNow is preferred.
* Experience with Azure DevOps for agile process management is preferred.

Skills

* Agile Methodologies – Agile project management is an iterative approach to delivering a project throughout its life cycle, taking incremental steps towards the completion of a project
* Analytical Thinking - Strong problem-solving skills to identify architectural challenges, analyze requirements, evaluate options, and propose effective solutions.
* Authentic Communicator - Expresses ideas and information, both verbally and in writing, clearly and credibly. Listens to understand and fosters constructive dialogue.
* Business Analysis - Analyzing current business state within the context of future business state expectations and determining whether new business strategies are needed to address existing issues or meet new needs. Estimating the level of effort to enhance or expand current business strategies.
* Business Partner Relations - The process of acting as a trusted advisor and building strong relationships with colleagues and the business to drive business performance.
* Business Process Modeling & Redesign - Execution of key business process with the objective of achieving a quantum jump in performance measures such as return on investment (ROI), cost reduction, and quality of service.
* Change Management – The process of controlled identification, planning and implementation of required initiatives to prepare, support and help individuals, teams and organizations to navigate through change.
* Continuous Improvement Mindset - Identifies and leads opportunities for continuous improvement and value creation, both incremental and large-scale.
* Incident Management – Ensuring that any incidents affecting processes and performances of relevant technology services or systems are managed appropriately to mitigate risk and minimize disruption.
* Quality Assurance (QA) – The process to ensure organizational activities are designed to ensure that an organization is providing the best possible product or service to customers.
* Requirements Management - The process of documenting, analyzing, tracing, prioritizing and agreeing on requirements and then controlling change while also communicating to relevant stakeholders.
* Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC) - A process used by the software industry to design, develop and test high quality software.
* Specifications Development - Understanding the context, stakeholders and requirements or features of a product or application and detailing the specifications around them.

As an energy industry leader, our career opportunities fuel personal and professional growth.

Findlay, Ohio

Additional locations:

San Antonio, Texas

00017272

539 S Main St

title: Field Solutions Engineer - USA
description:
**Miovision is a global industry leading company providing agencies and organizations modern tools to improve today’s traffic problems. We offer solutions that collect multimodal traffic data and uncover actionable insights, helping organizations get more out of their road network. The result: streets capable of moving more people – safely and efficiently – whether they are in a car, on a bus, on a bike or e-scooter, or walking. Since 2005, our systems have counted or assisted more than thirty billion vehicles around the world. With global headquarters in Kitchener, Canada, as well as operations in Germany, Serbia and the United States. For more information, visit** **miovision.com****.**
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

**Position Summary**

The Field Solutions Engineer (FSE) is a trusted technical expert who plays a pivotal role in the sales process, driving the growth and adoption of Miovision’s Intelligent Transportation System (ITS) solutions. These solutions include advanced traffic signal control, AI-powered video detection, connected vehicle applications, and cloud-based emergency vehicle preemption and priority systems. By bridging the gap between technical capabilities and customer needs, the FSE helps agencies realize the full value of Miovision’s innovative transportation technologies. This role will cover the Western US and involves regular travel within the region.

As a technical industry expert, the FSE integrates into the daily operation of the agency to support complex proof of concepts and ongoing initiatives to maximize product output and value. The FSE ensures continuous value and product adoption that ultimately drives intersection network and software growth.

**Key Accountabilities**
========================

Technical consultancy/ Supporting the sales process

The FSE is responsible for learning and understanding the current technical capabilities/systems/tools within the account ecosystem, and identifying and documenting the gaps that exist between the current state and the customer's desired state. This creates a plan of action/recommendations for the agency to successfully move from current state to desired outcome state with support and input from Miovision and Miovision's partners. Document product/feature needs for product design prioritization.

Solution scoping and design

The FSE would support solution design, technical documentation and the implementation plan of current desired integrations as set in the account plan. As the account evolves, the FSE would continuously build on possible integration opportunities and scope out any future integrations with the Miovision products and 3rd party systems. Establish a framework for necessary contributions from various departments and facilitate their collaboration. Work alongside project management teams to successfully monitor progress and implementation of initiatives.

Pilots and Product Demonstrations

The FSE would design and manage all product demonstrations highlighting the value of all Software and applications. The FSE would also manage all pilot installations and proof of value demonstration.

Product approval and specification process

With support from the APL team, work to achieve product approvals in assigned territory. In addition, work with customers and prospects to update their ITS specifications to incorporate Miovision Master Specification.

Complex issue resolution and customer advocacy

The FSE would support the resolution of any complex product issue resulting in prevention of purchase, delayed renewals or potential for churn. The FSE will always act as a customer advocate to ensure an effortless experience in resolving these challenges. The FSE would build a strong relationship between the Miovision product and support teams to ensure continuous resolution of ongoing operational issues as well as product deficiencies that may come up.

Proof of Value Documentation

Account plans are a recipe for delivering on potential product value as intended. Building success within the key accounts will create many product advocates and champions that can accelerate the creation of case studies and references. These individuals can then be leveraged for webinars and further our account-based marketing program.

**Skills/Qualifications**
=========================

* Bachelor’s degree or recognized equivalency or achievement of recognized professional level
* 8+ years of technical experience; must understand network products
* Ability to travel internationally, providing on-site consulting work to clients
* Ability to manage multiple projects utilizing strong planning and organizational skills
* Experience with general consulting skills that include team facilitation, business case development, strong business analysis skills, process mapping and process redesign
* Systems implementation skills: requirements/process analysis, conceptual and detailed design, configuration, testing, training, change management and support
* Analytical nature with the ability to solve complex business issues
* Basic understanding of product development and engineering processes.
* Membership in Industry Groups (IMSA/ITSA/ITE/etc) preferred as well as relevant industry Certifications

**Perks and Benefits**

* Comprehensive health benefits starting on day one
* 401(k) matching
* Mio-Days: We extend all three-day weekends to four-days and provide a Holiday Shutdown in December
* Internet subsidy and a remote work allowance
* Unlimited vacation policy
* Virtual fitness classes

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. Please indicate if you require accommodation on your application, and our team will work with you to meet your accessibility needs.

**PLEASE BE AWARE OF FRAUD:** Applicants interested in applying for roles at Miovision should apply directly via the details provided on our careers page. We communicate directly with applicants and will not request banking information, payment, or fees during any point of the recruitment process. We do not conduct interviews via text message. title: Business Solutions Manager
description:
**First Merchants Bank is seeking a Business Solutions Manager to join our team! The Business Solutions Manager will play a critical role in driving change across lines of business by ensuring effective prioritization, tracking, and delivery of initiatives across lines of business such as Consumer Banking, Small Business Banking, Commercial Banking, and Private Wealth. The position focuses on the accelerated execution of initiatives that transform and create value for our employees, clients, and other stakeholders. The most successful individuals in this role will develop an excellent understanding of the business domain and are typically superb “people persons” with exceptional communication skills. We seek someone with strong change management and communication abilities.**

**Essential Duties and Responsibilities:**

* Demonstrated experience managing complex portfolios and collaborating with a variety of stakeholders.
* Support operational planning and execution of business initiatives to ensure projects are delivered on time, within scope, and expected value realization.
* Collaborate with segment leaders to define portfolio priorities, support project intake, strategic insights, progress updates, and issue resolutions to ensure alignment with business strategic objectives.
* Drive cross-team collaboration and resolve cross-team impediments and other planning, collaboration, and coordination issues to ensure smooth transitions and adoption.
* In conjunction with Risk and Compliance stakeholders, proactively identify and address regulatory, risk, and compliance requirements.
* Contribute to communication plans to address resistance and ensure smooth transitions.
* Identify Business Process Improvements (BPI) and leverage best practices to enhance the efficiency and effectiveness of our stakeholders.
* Monitor key performance indicators (KPIs) and report on progress, be comfortable making adjustments, and change direction as needed to achieve the initiative's intended value.
* Proven success in implementing change across lines of business by providing a view of initiatives to ensure changes are embedded across all aspects of the line of business – operationally, strategically, and through change and communications.
* Proactively work with the project management team to manage and mitigate risks and issues by maintaining and communicating items on a RAID log.
* Leverage storytelling and visual aids that are easily understood and motivational by utilizing data tools such as PowerBi, Snowflake, and Excel.
* Conduct market research and competitive analysis to assist with data-driven decisions.
* Develop executive briefs and dashboards to help support teams make data-driven decisions and identify emerging risks.
* Help mentor team members to excel in thought leadership and facilitation and foster a high-performing, future-ready team.
* Acknowledge uncertainty and adapt to external (market) and internal changes by modifying plans and approaches. Use flexible principles to embrace change as opposed to constraining it.

**To be successful in this position, we require the following:**

* Bachelor’s degree in business, finance, operations, or a related field, OR associate degree/ two years of college + two (2) years of related work/military experience OR four (4) years of related work/military experience (plus any additional required experience).
* Minimum 5 years of experience in product, portfolio, process, operations, program management, or related roles.
* Minimum 5 years of experience in data analysis, business analysis, or related roles.
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills with the ability to build consensus with business partners.
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills to distill complex information into actionable insights.
* Comfortable with presenting to and facilitating discussions with senior business leaders. Strong facilitation, conflict resolution, negotiation, and influencing skills.

**The following would be a plus:**

* Certifications: Relevant certifications such as Project Management Professional (PMP), Six Sigma, Agile (e.g., ScrumMaster, Scaled Agile Framework (SAFe), or Certified Business Analysis Professional (CBAP) are highly desirable.
* Proficiency in portfolio management tools and multiple methodologies (SDLC, Waterfall, Agile).
* Financial segment experience.

**First Merchants offers the following:**

* Base Pay **PLUS Bonuses**
* Medical, Dental and Vision Insurance
* 401k
* Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts
* Vacation/Sick Time
* Paid Holidays
* Paid Parental Leave
* Tuition Reimbursement
* Additional Benefits

**A little about us:**

First Merchants is guided by a genuine philosophy of being a meaningful place to work and having a prosperous impact across all walks of life throughout the communities we serve, including consumers, businesses and other organizations. Our Vision, Mission and Team statement reflect and reinforce that authentic service philosophy.

**Our Vision is:**

To enhance the financial wellness of the diverse communities we serve.

**Our Mission is:**

To be the most responsive, knowledgeable, and high-performing financial organization for our clients, teammates, and shareholders.

**Our Team:**

"We are a collection of dynamic colleagues with diverse experiences and perspectives who share a passion for positively impacting lives. We are genuinely committed to attracting and engaging teammates of diverse backgrounds. We believe in the power of inclusion and belonging."

Apply today to begin your career with us!

Equal Opportunity Employer/Protected Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities  
This employer is required to notify all applicants of their rights pursuant to federal employment laws. For further information, please review the Know Your Rights notice from the Department of Labor.

title: Financial Analyst (Capital Markets (Investment Sales)
description:
**Job Title**

Financial Analyst (Capital Markets (Investment Sales)

**Job Description Summary**

The candidate will be primarily responsible for creating and analyzing reports to identify issues and develop solutions. Key responsibilities include ensuring data integrity to deliver accurate and efficient reporting solutions for our clients, team, and other service lines. This position directly supports the office's clients and brokerage accounts by implementing processes and validation measures aligned with the organization's finance team.

**Job Description**

**ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS AND BASIC DUTIES:**

* Provides key support and insight to the finance team for financial analysis and monthly reporting.
* Maintain a dynamic property directory as the client’s portfolio changes; update statuses, attributes, and facility contact workflows.
* Interacts closely with various other functions i.e. facilities, leasing, procurement, and external vendors to enable process improvements and accurate reporting.
* Reviews and actively monitors vendor statements to develop systems to ensure invoices are valid, paid, and processed on time.
* Review and allocate comprehensive invoices for various properties across the portfolio; liaise with vendors and procurement to ensure accuracy.
* Identify risks and opportunities to company operations specific to both business and financial results.
* Gather and report on cost savings across multiple service lines.
* Completes ad hoc projects and reports and manages smaller initiatives.

**MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS:**

1-3 years experience in analysis, reporting and decision support Degree in business, accounting, property management, or technology preferred Demonstrated success in leading and delivering solutions to complex business opportunities

Cushman & Wakefield also provides eligible employees with an opportunity to enroll in a variety of benefit programs, generally including health, vision, and dental insurance, flexible spending accounts, health savings accounts, retirement savings plans, life, and disability insurance programs, and paid and unpaid time away from work. In addition to a comprehensive benefits package, Cushman and Wakefield provide eligible employees with competitive pay, which may vary depending on eligibility factors such as geographic location, date of hire, total hours worked, job type, business line, and applicability of collective bargaining agreements.

* Ability to work under pressure and time constraints as well as handle several tasks simultaneously required
* Strong teamwork ethic, positive proactive flexible attitude ability to take complete ownership of responsibilities
* Strong analytical mindset and the ability to learn to take on new tasks
* Ability to assess granular level details to facilitate strategic high-level decision-making
* Must be self-driven and highly motivated
* Advanced skillset in Excel required, with experience in MQuery preferred
* Familiar with building Smartsheets and PowerBI dashboards a plus

  
Cushman & Wakefield is an Equal Opportunity employer to all protected groups, including protected veterans and individuals with disabilities. Discrimination of any type will not be tolerated.

In compliance with the Americans with Disabilities Act Amendments Act (ADAAA), if you have a disability and would like to request an accommodation in order to apply for a position at Cushman & Wakefield, please call the ADA line at **1-888-365-5406** or email **HRServices@cushwake.com**. Please refer to the job title and job location when you contact us.

title: Operations Test Analyst - Data Links
description:
JT4, LLC provides engineering and technical support to multiple western test ranges for the U.S. Air Force, Space Force, and Navy under the Joint Range Technical Services Contract, better known as J-Tech II. JT4 develops and maintains realistic, integrated test and training environments and prepares our nation's war-fighting aircraft, weapons systems, and aircrews for today's missions and tomorrow's global challenges.

**RANGE POSITION DESCRIPTION**

* Order aircraft data for a specific Data Link and Aircraft
* Run a software program or go through the data manually to analyze it. Complete computer data transfers including completion of proper documentation.
* Plan individually or with teammates Data Link test missions, and interact with other platforms to conduct Data Link Interoperability testing.
* Operate Data Link Equipment during actual missions to gather data from the aircraft and send stimulus to aircraft during missions to complete test operations.

**Ideal candidate:**

* Must have a basic understanding of Python.
* Must have a basic understanding of COMMS and Datalinks.
* Being a team player, having self-motivation to complete tasks on time, and with high quality is a must.
* Must have Strong Communication skills.
* Must be willing to work odd hours when needed.
* Must be familiar with hardware and software.

**DESIRED QUALIFICATIONS**

* Basic experience with operating common tactical data link radios/terminals/gateways/modems, MIDS LVT (Link 16), MIDS JTRS (Link 16), AN/ARC-210 (U/VHF), AN/PRC-117G (U/VHF).
* Familiarity with the following data link waveforms and protocols: Link 16, Variable Message Format (VMF), and the ability to develop and analyze data link messages (J-series messages, K-series messages).
* Ability to read and understand common military data link standards and protocols is desired: (MIL-STD 6016 (Link 16), MIL-STD 6017 (VMF).
* Familiarity with using tactical data link software: (Battlefield Operations Group Support System (BOSS), Amalgamated Remote Management System (ARMS), Link 16 Environment Gateway Stimulator (LEGS), Terminal Operational Environment Simulator (TOES), IDM Workbench. Protocol Analyzer, Message Analysis and Data Reduction for the Integration of Links (MANDRIL). Active Secret Clearance desired, Security Plus Certification desired.

**REQUIREMENTS - EDUCATION, TECHNICAL, AND WORK EXPERIENCE**

Completion of technical training and at least 10 years of related experience; or an associate degree and 7 years of related experience; or a related bachelor's degree (engineering, math, computer science, or physics) and 4 years of related experience; or a related Master's degree. The incumbent must understand concepts, principles, and practices of engineering and analysis to enable the employee to serve as a technical authority on projects relating to the specific programs. The position requires knowledge and skill sufficient to apply the latest developments in technology to solve problems in the specialty area. The incumbent must maintain excellent communication and analytical skills and working knowledge of computer systems and integrated software application programs.

The incumbent must possess a valid, state issued driver's license. The Operations/Test Analyst must be able to obtain and maintain a DoD security clearance up to Top Secret with special access. Must be a U.S. citizen.

**SALARY**

The expected salary range for this position is $91,748 to $130,000 annually.

**Note:** The salary range offered for this position is a good faith description of the expected salary range this role will pay. JT4, LLC considers factors such as (but not limited to) responsibilities of the position, candidate's work experience, education/training, key skills, internal peer equity, as well as, market and business considerations when extending an offer.

**BENEFITS**

* Medical, Dental, Vision Insurance
* + \\*\\*Benefits Active on Day 1
* Life Insurance
* Health Savings Accounts/FSA's
* Disability Insurance
* Paid Time Off
* 401(k) Plan Options with Employer Match
* + JT4 will match 50%, up to an 8% contribution
  + 100% Immediate Vesting
* Tuition Reimbursement

**OTHER RESPONSIBILITIES**

Each employee must read, understand, and implement the general and specific operational, safety, quality, and environmental requirements of all plans, procedures, and policies pertaining to their job.

**WORKING CONDITIONS**

Work is performed in a typical office environment with no unusual hazards. There is occasional lifting up to 20 pounds, constant sitting while using the computer terminal, constant use of sight abilities while reviewing documents, constant use of speech/hearing abilities for communication, and constant mental alertness. The incumbent must possess planning/organizing skills and must be able to work under deadlines.

**DISCLAIMER**

The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by personnel assigned to this classification. They are not intended to be construed as an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties, and skills required of persons so classified.

Tasking is in support of a Federal Government Contract that requires U.S. citizenship. Some jobs may require a candidate to be eligible for a government security clearance, state-issued driver's license or other licenses/certifications, and the inability to obtain and maintain the required clearance, license or certification may affect an employee's ability to maintain employment.

title: Business Systems Analyst
description:
**Title:** Business Systems Analyst DSP02739

**State Role Title:** Info Technology Specialist III

**Hiring Range:** Negotiable and Commensurate with Experience

**Pay Band:** 6

**Agency:** Department of State Police

**Location:** North Chesterfield, Virginia

**Agency Website:** vsp.virginia.gov

**Recruitment Type:** General Public - G

**Job Duties**

About the Position:
  
  
The Virginia State Police (VSP) is seeking to hire a Business Systems Analyst in our Criminal Justice Information Services (CJIS) Division at State Police Headquarters in North Chesterfield, Virginia. The successful candidate will identify business rules and requirements, extract and analyze data, recommend data quality improvements, respond to audit requests, and lead efforts to automate CJIS responses to frequently occurring audits; review and analyze VSP operations, processes, system interfaces and technical solutions for the purpose of developing and implementing business requirements and improvements; propose, design, and implement public-facing services; determine project scope and drafts project plans; lead and coordinate VSP supplier and Information Technology (IT) Division system activities related to solution design, testing, training, implementation, and support; provide support services for VSP operations and systems; provide technical expertise to help ensure accurate data quality across all VSP systems; and perform detailed data analysis tasks including deriving requirements from existing data sources, defining what is accurate data, identifying/defining data relationships that allow for accurate data analysis, converting data from existing sources into databases to be used for analysis, conducting complex database queries to retrieve data for analysis, identifying data quality errors, documenting findings and making recommendations to improve data quality, and determining data conversion and system interface requirements.  
  
About the Agency:  
  
We are seeking to expand our diverse team of change makers and innovators. As a member of the VSP family, you would make a difference by serving every city, county, town, resident, and visitor of the Commonwealth through supporting our vast public safety mission. Challenge yourself to make a difference today by applying for a career with VSP!
  
  
VSP embraces inclusion and diversity in our workforce and in the protection of all people. We embrace our tradition of professionalism and excellence, and we are excited for our future as we continue our journey to become a best-in-class state government agency. We are firmly committed to our family-like culture and are seeking to expand our team.

  

**Minimum Qualifications**

* This position is 100% on-site; no telework option at this time.
* Considerable knowledge and experience with business analysis, data analysis, developing requirements, testing, and identifying and documenting system deficiencies is required.
* Experience with business process analysis, process improvement and process design are required.
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills and experience is required.
* Knowledge and/or experience with software development methodologies, including Agile, is required.
* Strong oral and written communications skills with team(s), management, and stakeholders is required.
* Experience producing project deliverables such as requirements documents, Agile stories and test plans is required.
* Ability to successfully interact in a team environment and effectively communicate in English, both orally and in writing.
* Ability to support and troubleshoot Information Technology (IT) applications is required.
* Ability to work independently is required.
* Limited travel is required to outlying VSP Divisions and Area Offices is required.
* High School Diploma or GED equivalent.

**Additional Considerations**

* Experience with automated reporting tools is preferred.
* Proficiency with Microsoft Office is preferred.
* Ability to create and analyze Requests for Proposals (RFPs), Statement of Works (SOWs), Service Level Agreements (SLAs), pricing and other documents required by state procurement processes is preferred.
* Ability to create and analyze Project Scope documents and project budgets is preferred.
* Experience supporting a criminal justice application is preferred.
* Experience working with technical staff is preferred.
* Leadership experience desired.
* Experience in business administration, computer science or related field is preferred.

**Special Instructions**

You will be provided a confirmation of receipt when your application and/or résumé is submitted successfully. Please refer to “Your Application” in your account to check the status of your application for this position.

Elements of the selection process include the screening of application(s); the interviewing of qualified candidate(s), to include pre-employment testing, a presentation and/or a work sample, if applicable; salary negotiation(s) if applicable; a background investigation; and a medical evaluation if applicable. The anticipated duration of the pre-employment process is determined by the successful completion of the above items.
  
  
Applications, cover letters and/or resumes shall only be accepted on-line through the PageUp recruitment management system at https://jobs.virginia.gov and must be received by 11:55 P. M. on July 2, 2025. Please limit resumes to four pages and cover letters to one page. Any additional attachments received in excess of this will not be considered.  
  
PageUp provides a confirmation of receipt of your application, resume and/or cover letter submitted successfully. Please refer to your PageUp account to check the status of your application for this position. For questions, please contact the Employment Unit of the Human Resources Division at civilianemployment@vsp.virginia.gov.
  
The Department of State Police is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Our policy is to extend opportunities to qualified applicants and employees on an equal basis regardless of an individual’s race, color, gender, age, national origin, religion, citizenship status, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, transgender status, physical or mental disability, protected veteran status, genetic information, pregnancy, parental status, political affiliation, or any other categories protected by applicable federal, state, or local laws.  
  
REASONABLE ACCOMMODATIONS ARE AVAILABLE UPON REQUEST  
  
(V)alor (S)ervice (P)ride

  

In support of the Commonwealth’s commitment to inclusion, we are encouraging individuals with disabilities to apply through the Commonwealth Alternative Hiring Process. To be considered for this opportunity, applicants will need to provide their AHP Letter (formerly COD) provided by the Department for Aging & Rehabilitative Services (DARS), or the Department for the Blind & Vision Impaired (DBVI). Service-Connected Veterans are encouraged to answer Veteran status questions and submit their disability documentation, if applicable, to DARS/DBVI to get their AHP Letter. Requesting an AHP Letter can be found at AHP Letter or by calling DARS at 800-552-5019.

Note**:** Applicants who received a Certificate of Disability from DARS or DBVI dated between April 1, 2022- February 29, 2024, can still use that COD as applicable documentation for the Alternative Hiring Process.

Each agency within the Commonwealth of Virginia is dedicated to recruiting, supporting, and maintaining a competent and diverse work force. **Equal Opportunity Employer**

title: Senior Business Analyst - Medicaid
description:
Great companies need great teams to propel their operations. Join the group that solves business challenges and enhances the way we work and grow. Working at Gainwell carries its rewards. You’ll have an incredible opportunity to grow your career in a company that values your contributions and puts a premium on work flexibility, learning, and career development.

**Summary**
-----------

As a **Senior Business Analyst - Medicaid** at Gainwell, you can contribute your skills as we harness the power of technology to help our clients improve the health and well-being of the members they serve — a community’s most vulnerable. Connect your passion with purpose, teaming with people who thrive on finding innovative solutions to some of healthcare’s biggest challenges. This candidate will be working closely with the PM, and the state to write requirements for all of the change requests. Here are the details on this position.

**Your role in our mission**
----------------------------

Play a critical part in ensuring Gainwell is meeting our clients’ objectives in important areas.

* Help coordinate a business analyst team’s duties and activities on IT projects and nurture newer team members by providing guidance and support
* Be a knowledgeable bridge between clients, project managers and technical staff to define, document and share business requirements and expected impact
* Work with the client to develop business specs at the start of a technical project
* Analyze, plan, design, document or make recommendations to improve business processes to support client’s technology goals
* Help verify that all requirements have been met by approving and validating test results
* Exercise your ability to use basic analytical or relational database software — such as Excel or SQL — to quantify the anticipated impact of work

**What we're looking for**
--------------------------

* 6 or more years Business Analyst experience in healthcare industry with 3 or more years of Medicaid and Medicare experience strongly preferred
* Third Party Liability and Managed Care experience a plus
* Knowledge of computer programming concepts such as configuration, development and batch processing
* Advanced knowledge in analytical software such as Microsoft Excel or SQL and other requirement-mapping tools such as Application Lifecycle Management (ALM) tools
* Strong Client Facing experience with ability to communicate and translate client needs to actionable objectives
* Strong analytical and business process re-engineering skills
* Strong executive presence and communication skills to deliver messages to business leaders, clients and technical personnel
* A leader who motivates others to action and communicates key technical ideas in a digestible way

**Additional skills and competencies**
--------------------------------------

* Microsoft Office Suite – required
* Organizational skills – ability to prioritize your work load – required
* Strong Client facing experience – required
* Ability to write requirements – required
* Creativity – ability to connect seamlessly on related dots – required
* RTrace – preferred
* ServiceNow – preferred

**What you should expect in this role**
---------------------------------------

* Fully remote opportunity from most Continental US locations only
* Video cameras must be used during all interviews, as well as during the initial week of orientation
* **The deadline to submit applications for this posting is July 3, 2025.**
* #LI-HC1

The pay range for this position is $64,900.00 - $92,700.00 per year, however, the base pay offered may vary depending on geographic region, internal equity, job-related knowledge, skills, and experience among other factors. Put your passion to work at Gainwell. You’ll have the opportunity to grow your career in a company that values work flexibility, learning, and career development. All salaried, full-time candidates are eligible for our generous, flexible vacation policy, a 401(k) employer match, comprehensive health benefits, and educational assistance. We also have a variety of leadership and technical development academies to help build your skills and capabilities.

We believe nothing is impossible when you bring together people who care deeply about making healthcare work better for everyone. Build your career with Gainwell, an industry leader. You’ll be joining a company where collaboration, innovation, and inclusion fuel our growth. Learn more about Gainwell at our company website and visit our Careers site for all available job role openings.

*Gainwell Technologies* *is an Equal Opportunity Employer, where all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical condition), age, sexual orientation, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics.*

title: Business Systems Analyst, Retirement Benefits Operations
description:
**Position** **Summary**

Serve as the technical liaison for Retirement Benefits Operations and Technical Operations with programmers, vendors and operations. Collect and analyze data to ensure accurate and effective administration. Write requirements, maintain documentation, perform testing, prepare reporting, and maintain excellent relationships internally and externally in accordance with Company mission, guidelines, client needs and legislative requirements.

**“** Position requires access to Personally Identifiable Information and/or Personal Health Information to complete job requirements.”

**Key** **Duties** **and** **Responsibilities**
-----------------------------------------------

* **Analyzes programming changes and/or system enhancements to existing programs; tests and verify the accuracy of program changes.**
* **Tests programming changes due to bug fixes, enhancements, development, and version upgrades.**
* **Collaborates with programmers, operations, and external vendors to drive quality output through understanding and consideration of impact to all areas**
* **Provides technical support, training, and problem resolution to end users.**
* **Designs, generates, creates, and evaluates operational reports, queries, data, and procedures regarding systems, including scheduling and distribution of reports.**
* **Analyzes data files, proactively identifies trends and/or issues and collaborates with operations to enhance our clients’ experience.**
* **Writes requirements for software changes, coordinates changes with vendors and operations.**
* **Represents Retirement Benefits Operations and Technical Operations on projects for new and existing client implementations, including establishing requirements, planning, testing and communicating with the project team, internal operations clients and external partners.**
* **Documents system and client support processes, including maintaining operations workflows and documentation.**
* **Maintains excellent internal relationships client and external partner relationships to advance client and participant experience and relations on behalf of Zenith.**
* **Performs other related duties and special projects as assigned.**
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

**Working** **Conditions/Physical** **Effort**
----------------------------------------------

* Normal degree of physical effort in a typical office environment with comfortable, constant temperatures and absence of objectionable elements.
* May be required to work remotely.

**Minimum** **Qualifications**
------------------------------

* High school diploma but 4 year college degree is preferred.
* Two years of experience as a Business Systems Analyst ***or*** two years of experience working in a benefit administration environment with applicable technical expertise.
* Experience working with group Retirement Plans with an emphasis on Defined Benefit Plans.
* Strong working knowledge of Excel, SharePoint, Smartsheet, and Microsoft Suite.
* Basic understanding of business practices with good understanding of project management methodology.
* An understanding of database systems and applications.
* Collaborative, accountable, takes initiative, and successfully coordinates with cross-functional teams to enhance service delivery
* Strong organizational, analytical, problem-solving, and time-management skills.
* Ability to exercise independent judgment.
* Excellent attention to detail.
* Excellent oral and written communication skills, including the ability to work with diverse groups of professionals in close cooperation.

**Preferred** **Qualifications**
--------------------------------

* Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Math, Computer Science, Business or Information Technology.
* Experience working with Taft Hartley retirement plans.

*\\*Please note this job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee of this job. Duties, responsibilities and activities may change at any time with or without notice.*

**Disability Accommodation**
----------------------------

Consistent with the Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA) and other applicable federal and state law, it is the policy of Zenith American Solutions to provide reasonable accommodation when requested by a qualified applicant or employee with a disability, unless such accommodation would cause an undue hardship. The policy regarding requests for reasonable accommodation applies to all aspects of employment, including the application process. If reasonable accommodation is needed, please contact the Recruiting Department at recruiting@zenith-american.com , and we would be happy to assist you.

**Zenith American Solutions**

**Real People. Real Solutions. National Reach. Local Expertise.**

We are currently looking for a dedicated, energetic employee with the necessary skills, initiative, and personality, along with the desire to get the most out of their working life, to help us be our best every day.

Zenith American Solutions is the largest independent Third Party Administrator in the United States and currently operates over 44 offices nationwide. The original entity of Zenith American has been in business since 1944. Our company was formed as the result of a merger between Zenith Administrators and American Benefit Plan Administrators in 2011. By combining resources, best practices and scale, the new organization is even stronger and better than before.

We believe the best way to realize our better systems for better service philosophy is to hire the best employees. We're always looking for talented individuals who share our dedication to high-quality work, exceptional service and mutual respect. If you're interested in working in an environment where people - employees and clients - really matter, consider bringing your talents to Zenith American!

We realize the importance a comprehensive benefits program to our employees and their families. As part of our total compensation package, we offer an array of benefits including health, vision, and dental coverage, a retirement savings 401(k) plan with company match, paid time off (PTO), great opportunities for growth, and much, much more!

title: Associate Sales Operations Analyst
description:
**Who We Are**

Johns Manville is a leading manufacturer and marketer of premium-quality insulation and commercial roofing, along with glass fibers and nonwovens for commercial, industrial and residential applications. Our products are used in a wide variety of industries including building products, aerospace, automotive and transportation, filtration, commercial interiors, waterproofing and wind energy.

A proud member of the Berkshire Hathaway family of companies, we serve customers in more than 80 countries around the globe. We are committed to delivering positive and powerful experiences, because we are successful only when our employees and customers thrive. We are passionate, we care about people, we perform at a superior level, and we protect others and our environments.

**Pay Range**

$57,800.00-$79,400.00 Annual

This is the base salary pay range that an applicant can expect to make upon hire. Pay within this range will vary based upon relevant experience, skills, and education among other factors. In addition, this position is eligible for an incentive bonus.

The primary purpose of the Associate Sales Operations Analyst is to support the transition from the Sales Opportunity process into the Guarantee (system warranty), own the Guarantee process, and ensure that JM customers installing JM Roofing Systems receive a high level of service on all Guarantee matters. This role will coordinate the Guarantee process from sales order and/or initial technical review through Guarantee issuance, respond in a timely manner to all customer requests, work with JM stakeholders to resolve complex situations, and be the Guarantee subject matter expert for the JM Roofing Systems team.

In this role, you will get to problem solve with customers and JM teammates on a daily basis, learn the commercial roofing industry, have exposure to the Sales Opportunity process, and be an important part of JM’s commercial roofing business operations.

If you are passionate about building relationships, managing a business operation, and enjoy project organization, then this role may be for you!

Anticipated deadline to apply: 7/15/25. This deadline is Johns Manville’s good faith estimate of when the application will close. Johns Manville may extend the deadline and will update this posting promptly if it is extended.

**Your Day-to-Day:**

* Own and facilitate the Guarantee process: coordinate & configure Guarantee application data from Sales Opportunity process, support Guarantee application submission, connect Guarantee with the Sales Opportunity process, ensure all Guarantee requirements met, manage billing & invoicing, manage change requests, and front line support for the customer portal.
* Act as an advisor for and partner with roofing contractors to proactively move Guarantees towards issuance and troubleshoot customer issues, including portal support.
* Partner with team members across Roofing Systems Division and JM Corporate teams to deliver a best-in-class Guarantee processing experience by providing quick responses and connecting the right parties to resolve issues: JM Sales Representatives, Field Technical Representatives, Tech Specialists, Account Managers, Credit Specialists, and Tax Department.
* Be the Salesforce subject matter expert (SME) on the Guarantee process, including providing training, process support, and maintaining reports.
* Manage and maintain Guarantee specific reports and documentation, ensuring best practices for document control.
* Troubleshoot data quality issues, maintain accurate data, and support ongoing data hygiene projects.
* Support one to two continuous improvement projects per year.

**What You Bring to the Team:**

* Bachelor's Degree with 0-2 year of experience in a customer-centric sales/service operations or project management position OR High School/Technical School Diploma with 3-5 years of experience in a customer-centric or sales/service operations position
* Excellent attention to detail, organizational, and prioritization skills
* Excellent self-motivation
* Excellent written and verbal communication
* Excellent problem solving skills
* Solid adaptability and flexibility
* Solid ability to build relationships with internal partners and external customers
* Solid listening skills
* Solid ability to think through complex issues
* Solid level of Microsoft Office (Outlook, Word, PowerPoint)
* Experience with Microsoft Excel
* Experience in understanding and articulating organizational goals and applying to day-to-day activities
* Experience working directly with customers via phone and face-to-face in a proactive and reactive manner
* Passion for results and a sense of urgency in completing tasks
* Basic problem resolution and negotiation skills
* Minimal travel required: 0-10 days per year

**Preferred Requirements:**

* Bachelor’s Degree or Advanced Degree with 5 years of experience in a customer-centric position; 8 years of customer-centric experience, in lieu of degree
* SAP Experience
* Salesforce Experience
* Knowledge of commercial roofing industry

**Please Keep in Mind**

If you do not meet 100% of these requirements, we at JM still want to hear from you. So, if you are interested in the role, we encourage you to apply so we can learn how your skills and talents can contribute to our team.

**Benefits**

Johns Manville (JM) offers a wide range of benefits to employees. Some are subsidized by the company and others are fully employee-paid. Health benefits include a choice of comprehensive medical plans, a dental plan, vision plan, wellness program and critical illness insurance. JM sponsors a 401(k) plan which includes a sizeable company match. JM offers paid vacation and also provides paid sick and parental leave for eligible employees.

Additionally, Johns Manville provides basic life Insurance, short-term and long-term disability coverage, an employee assistance program, and business travel accident coverage. Supplemental life insurance and accidental death and dismemberment insurance are available as well. The company also offers a variety of tax saving accounts; health spending account, traditional flexible spending account, and a dependent care spending account. JM also offers a tuition reimbursement program for undergraduate and certain graduate programs.

Johns Manville supports employee growth with vast educational opportunities and a company-wide mentoring program. This program pairs employees and leaders to grow skills, build stronger internal networks and strengthen the company’s succession planning process. Johns Manville also offers soft and hard skills training facilitated by internal and external presenters. Our talent management team prioritizes the holistic growth of our workforce.

**Diversity & Inclusion**

Johns Manville believes diversity and inclusion in our workplace is critical for the long-term success of our company. We are committed to retaining, developing and attracting a diverse workforce that fosters an inclusive work environment in which all employees are treated with dignity and respect. This is the right thing to do for our employees, our company and our communities. Our D&I council is composed of employees from locations across North American & Europe who meet regularly and work to promote and foster an environment of inclusion. Born from our D&I council is our network of employee resource groups (ERGs) that are focused on supporting diverse communities in the workplace. Review more about our diversity & inclusion initiatives on JM’s Career page.

Incumbent must be physically able to perform essential job functions. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform essential job functions.

We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. We maintain a drug-free workplace and perform pre-employment substance abuse testing.
company_description: Johns Manville, a Berkshire Hathaway company, manufactures insulation, roofing materials, and engineered products.

title: Senior Business Analyst Communications Specialist, OptumRx - Remote from Central or Eastern time zones only or Michigan based
description:
Optum is a global organization that delivers care, aided by technology to help millions of people live healthier lives. The work you do with our team will directly improve health outcomes by connecting people with the care, pharmacy benefits, data and resources they need to feel their best. Here, you will find a culture guided by inclusion, talented peers, comprehensive benefits and career development opportunities. Come make an impact on the communities we serve as you help us advance health optimization on a global scale. Join us to start **Caring. Connecting. Growing together.**

  

The Sr. Business Development Analyst/Communications Specialist serves as the expert on the State client’s member communications requirements. You will work as the liaison between the OptumRx operational staff / Marketing team and the State Staff to ensure we have a documented communication strategy and meet the client’s needs. You will be responsible for the oversight of all health benefit fair and member communication activity related to the client’s pharmacy benefit. You will interact with multiple internal departments to deliver best-in-class service to our client. As the Communications Specialist you will be engaged in discussions with the PBM account team, marketing team to ensure all the required benefit events and communications have been delivered. This position requires a high-performing individual with proven communication skills and a comprehensive understanding of pharmacy benefit design.

  

If you are located in Eastern or Central Time Zones only due to frequent travel, you will have the flexibility to work remotely\\* as you take on some tough challenges.

  

**Primary Responsibilities:**

* Understanding the primary business objectives of the client in order to communicate and assist marketing with communications that demonstrate program value to the client.
* Support Marketing with ensuring open enrollment materials are completed on time
* Responsible for the coordination of Health Benefit fairs
* Collaborate with the Client regarding future plan design changes, including but not limited to, working with the Marketing Team to coordinating focus groups to gather information market strategies/trends, conducting buyer vs. non-buyer surveys. Work with the client to understand their needs with respect to benefit competitive analysis and lead completion of these activities.
* Provide regular input to the Account Manager and operational areas regarding client benefit structure and requirements.
* Assist with the development, review and approve all benefit related Customer Service documentation to ensure accuracy with the plan design and when necessary participate in client specific benefit design training with Call Center Staff.
* Understands OptumRx product and service offering, and can articulate the operational, clinical and financial value of our programs to the client across multiple stakeholders with the goal of deploying new programs and services.
* Maintains consistent and regular communication with the client. Respond to all electronic, phone, facsimile or letter inquiries from the client within 24 hours and 2 hours for emergency inquiries.
* Participate and present formal presentations to stakeholders
* Responds to all electronic, phone, facsimile or letter inquiries from the client’s staff within twenty-four hours of receipt or two hours for urgent inquiries.
* Regularly attends and actively participates in company meetings as requested.
* Exhibits compliant and ethical behavior in the performance of job responsibilities, including complying with all applicable federal and state laws and regulations, OptumRx Code of Conduct, Business Ethics Policies and Procedures and other policies and procedures applicable to position.
* Actively participates in OptumRx’s Compliance and Ethics Program, including attending annual compliance and ethics training and reporting suspected violations of the law or OptumRx’s policies and procedures.
* Performs other duties as assigned to meet corporate objectives.

  

You’ll be rewarded and recognized for your performance in an environment that will challenge you and give you clear direction on what it takes to succeed in your role as well as provide development for other roles you may be interested in.

**Required Qualifications:**

* 2+ years of consultative pharmacy benefit experience with an understanding of pharmacy benefit strategies and pricing practices
* 2+ years of experience presenting to large group settings
* Experience developing communication materials such as PowerPoint decks, member communications, etc.
* Experience solving practical issues and dealing with many variables in situations where only limited standardization exists
* Project management and organizational skills to coordinate client deliverables
* Experience handling and resolving complex client issues
* Experience developing client relationships with attention to service
* Willing or ability to travel up to 25% of the time by car and airplane

  

**Preferred Qualifications:**

* Experience interfacing with client account leadership at the C level in healthcare or managed care
* Formulary knowledge
* Proficient knowledge of Medicare Part D Employer Group Waiver Plans
* Intermediate proficiency with MS Office Tools

  

* All employees working remotely will be required to adhere to UnitedHealth Group’s Telecommuter Policy

  

The salary range for this role is $89,800 to $176,700 annually based on full-time employment. Pay is based on several factors including but not limited to local labor markets, education, work experience, certifications, etc. UnitedHealth Group complies with all minimum wage laws as applicable. In addition to your salary, UnitedHealth Group offers benefits such as, a comprehensive benefits package, incentive and recognition programs, equity stock purchase and 401k contribution (all benefits are subject to eligibility requirements). No matter where or when you begin a career with UnitedHealth Group, you’ll find a far-reaching choice of benefits and incentives.

  

**Application Deadline:** This will be posted for a minimum of 2 business days or until a sufficient candidate pool has been collected. Job posting may come down early due to volume of applicants.

  

*At UnitedHealth Group, our mission is to help people live healthier lives and make the health system work better for everyone. We believe everyone–of every race, gender, sexuality, age, location and income–deserves the opportunity to live their healthiest life. Today, however, there are still far too many barriers to good health which are disproportionately experienced by people of color, historically marginalized groups and those with lower incomes. We are committed to mitigating our impact on the environment and enabling and delivering equitable care that addresses health disparities and improves health outcomes — an enterprise priority reflected in our mission.*

  

*UnitedHealth Group is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer under applicable law and qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, national origin, religion, age, color, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, or protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by local, state, or federal laws, rules, or regulations.*

  

*UnitedHealth Group is a drug - free workplace. Candidates are required to pass a drug test before beginning employment.*

title: Business Process - UAT Test Analyst - National Remote
description:
Optum is a global organization that delivers care, aided by technology to help millions of people live healthier lives. The work you do with our team will directly improve health outcomes by connecting people with the care, pharmacy benefits, data and resources they need to feel their best. Here, you will find a culture guided by diversity and inclusion, talented peers, comprehensive benefits and career development opportunities. Come make an impact on the communities we serve as you help us advance health equity on a global scale. Join us to start **Caring. Connecting. Growing together.**

UAT tester to work within the UAT Team to help us ensure our products are tested and delivered having met the highest quality testing standards available in the organization in a timely manner. In this highly visible role, you will also have the opportunity to participate in building and establishing our policies, standards and procedures for the UAT Team.

This position is full-time (40 hours/week) Monday - Friday. Employees are required to have flexibility to work any of our 8-hour shift schedules during our normal business hours of 8:00am - 5:00pm CST. It may be necessary, given the business need, to work occasional overtime or weekends.

We offer weeks of on-the-job training. The hours during training will be 8:00am – 5:00pm CST, Monday – Friday.

You’ll enjoy the flexibility to telecommute\\* from anywhere within the U.S. as you take on some tough challenges.

  

**Primary Responsibilities:**

* Perform User Acceptance Testing (UAT) and Quality Assurance
  + Analyze and decompose business requirements to extract test requirements
  + Developing / implementing / executing effective test plans and test cases
  + Testing of system requirements and enhancements and/or fixes
  + Analyzing data, researching & troubleshooting issues to define root cause and providing results
  + Logging & tracking defects to closure
  + Monitoring, measuring and communicating test results
  + Help ensure new system requirements/enhancements/changes are tested thoroughly, accurately and delivered in a timely manner
* Create and prepare UAT documentation, communication, and process workflow
* Provide consistent and repeatable testing process for UAT; may work with business analyst to execute test scenarios.
* Work closely with Project Team to identify risks early
* Improve processes and reduce post implementation issues
* Create and maintain documentation, communication, and process workflow
* Other tasks may include support other project testing as needed, running reports and pulling data from the RxCLAIM system for audits on pharmacy claims data, making recommendations to the development team to improve the system and using query language to create the reports from various relational databases
* Project management skills – manage multiple priorities

  

You’ll be rewarded and recognized for your performance in an environment that will challenge you and give you clear direction on what it takes to succeed in your role as well as provide development for other roles you may be interested in.

**Required Qualifications:**

* High School Diploma / GED OR equivalent work experience
* Must be 18 years of age OR older
* 2+ years of User Acceptance/QA testing experience for enterprise-level applications, including writing test cases from business requirement and executing / validating test results
* 2+ years of experience with performing business process and data analysis
* 1+ years Claim processing experience using Optum's RxCLAIM on IBM AS400
* Intermediate level proficiency: Microsoft Office Suite, Microsoft Excel, Microsoft Word, Microsoft PowerPoint
* Experience with developing process documentation and process improvement workflow
* Ability to understand and clearly articulate business and system functionality requirements and / OR process flows as it relates to test cases and test results
* Experience with handling multiple projects simultaneously and in a fast-paced environment
* Ability to work flexible schedule during holidays and peak period (November through January)
* Ability to work any of our 8-hour shift schedules during our normal business hours of 8:00am - 5:00pm CST. It may be necessary, given the business need, to work occasional overtime or weekends

  

**Preferred Qualifications:**

* Medicare Part D
* Previous automation experience
* Healthcare insurance or claims experience
* Intermediate proficiency level in Microsoft Access
* Understanding of Claims Admin workflows and processes

  

**Telecommuting Requirements:**

* Ability to keep all company sensitive documents secure (if applicable)
* Required to have a dedicated work area established that is separated from other living areas and provides information privacy
* Must live in a location that can receive a UnitedHealth Group approved high-speed internet connection or leverage an existing high-speed internet service

  

**Soft Skills:**

* Excellent interpersonal skills at both individual and team level
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills
* Strong analytical and organizational skills
* Self-driven yet team oriented

  

* All employees working remotely will be required to adhere to UnitedHealth Group’s Telecommuter Policy

  

Pay is based on several factors including but not limited to local labor markets, education, work experience, certifications, etc. In addition to your salary, we offer benefits such as, a comprehensive benefits package, incentive and recognition programs, equity stock purchase and 401k contribution (all benefits are subject to eligibility requirements). No matter where or when you begin a career with us, you’ll find a far-reaching choice of benefits and incentives. The hourly pay for this role will range from $28.27 - $50.48 per hour based on full-time employment. We comply with all minimum wage laws as applicable.

  

***Application Deadline:*** *This will be posted for a minimum of 2 business days or until a sufficient candidate pool has been collected. Job posting may come down early due to volume of applicants.*

  

*At UnitedHealth Group, our mission is to help people live healthier lives and make the health system work better for everyone. We believe everyone–of every race, gender, sexuality, age, location, and income–deserves the opportunity to live their healthiest life. Today, however, there are still far too many barriers to good health which are disproportionately experienced by people of color, historically marginalized groups, and those with lower incomes. We are committed to mitigating our impact on the environment and enabling and delivering equitable care that addresses health disparities and improves health outcomes — an enterprise priority reflected in our mission.*

  

*UnitedHealth Group is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer under applicable law and qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, national origin, religion, age, color, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, or protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by local, state, or federal laws, rules, or regulations.*

  

*UnitedHealth Group is a drug - free workplace. Candidates are required to pass a drug test before beginning employment.*
